All Reviews

  1. Definitely makes your teeth feel cleaner, and there is a noticeable difference as far as whitening. The two-step process isn't time consuming at all, takes almost the same amount of time to be honest. I'm not seeing any extreme difference but it's pretty good. Worth the $12 I paid.
  2. Only used a few days and have already noticed a difference. Cant wait to see how much more white they become. I did have to switch to a sensitive tooth brush instead of soft as the product does tend to cause tender gums
  3. It's okay. My teeth are just as white as before I used this product (a month straight). But this does give me a clean feeling.
  4. As a person with sensitive teeth I was wary of trying another product other than my usual sensodine. But there was a coupon and this product only cost me 8 bucks so I figured might as well! I have used this for six days and so far, I haven't noticed a sensitivity issue!! And I have noticed my teeth are getting whiter!!! I think I have found my new tooth paste!
  5. only used a few times. my teeth did not feel clean any of those times.
  6. Lies! I don't see any difference in my teeth. They want you to spend so much money on a product that doesn't do what it says it should. Very disappointed.
  7. Great product and delivered very fast.
  8. I absolutely love this. The minty toothpaste is very refreshing!. Simply brush with the step one toothpaste for about a minute, spit, no rinse, then proceed to brush for an additional minute with the step two whitening gel. Leaves your teeth feeling clean and smooth, your breath very nice and refreshing, and whitens your teeth to boot. Love it!
  9. I really like this two step toothpaste. Step 1 leaves your teeth feeling super clean, and Step 2 helps lift and remove stains. I wouldn't say it works as good as their high end whitestrips, but it does remove surface stains. I've been using Invisalign for the last year which creates stains on my teeth faster than usual, so this toothpaste has been awesome at preventing that. I'll be buying it again.
  10. Let's get one thing straight: it's not a whitening toothpaste. With that being said, this is one of the most expensive and yet worth every penny toothpastes you'll ever use! After the first brush my mouth felt great. It actually felt post dental cleaning but not sore clean. And I've been using it for weeks, two weeks straight and then 3x /week night and day WITH A WHITENING TOOTHPASTE and I have noticed a difference in my gums but also in how my teeth just feel better. You will get a more naturally white look from this alone, but if you want pearly whites, use the other whitening products also. But I cannot stress enough how healthy your mouth will feel.
  11. I liked this product to the point where I purchased another box at Walmart. OK, but 6x whiter? I think that's a statement that is relative to the consumer but to me? Nope, it did not make my teeth 6x whiter but my teeth are white already and I am just obsessed with making my teeth whiter always! I think this is a great maintenance product for your teeth. Step 2: a barely noticeable taste, somewhat like baking soda.<br /><br />Effectiveness: I could tell a difference after the third use. I've had it for about two weeks now and there was no color guide in it so I can't tell you how many shades whiter my teeth are, but the results are ok, not fabulous and I really doubt it's six shades. However the product works better than cheaper &#34;whitening&#34; toothpastes. I also feel like my mouth, gums and teeth are cleaner, not just whitened. They feel very slippery<br />.<br />Side effects: With continued use, my teeth are becoming sore, as are my gums. And to be clear, I do not have sensitive teeth. I plan to discontinue using daily and will probably only use it every 3-4 days. Also, I cannot use any mouthwash after brushing (which is a huge negative for me) because the sensitivity is killer. I also find myself rinsing a lot more to get the product out of my mouth.<br /><br />Final thoughts: Effective, yes, but with side effects.

  37. As a once a day, HUGE cup of hot tea drinker, as I inch towards 50, I have noticed that the tea stains are starting to remain on my once white teeth! I've tried all the teeth whitening strips out there only to find that with my receding gum lines, I tend to find these strips very painful almost immediately. So as a Bzz agent, when the opportunity arose for me to try Crest's new Pro Heath HD 2 step toothpaste program, I jumped at it but I was still somewhat skeptical as well. Any toothpaste that promises to whiten your teeth usually is a false claim from past experience. This system is, as it states, a 2 step program. It does require that you brush your teeth for 1 full minute with each step which for most people is probably more than they're used to brushing!<br /><br />From the very first use, I was pleasantly surprised at how clean my teeth felt! I've used Crest toothpaste off and on for my of my life. That means I've also used other brands. Not once has ANY of the toothpastes I've used ever gotten my teeth as clean feeling as this 2 step program did. I was very, very impressed with step 1. Then I moved on to step 2 which is the whitening step. Of course, I didn't notice anything different in color immediately but at the end of a week, I did notice the tea stains mostly gone from my teeth. On day 2, I noticed that when I went to apply step 2, the area where my gums have a tendency to recede (from years of over brushing!) was a bit painful but I learned if I started that step on the other side of my mouth and worked my way over to that side and it no longer hurt. If I put the paste direcly on the receding gums, that's when it hurt. Other than that, I had no issues with this program and have nothing but good things to say about it. I can only recommend it for everyone to try!
  38. When I first received my sample of this two step toothpaste from BzzAgent, I must admit I was more than a little skeptical that 1. It would actually whiten my teeth and 2. Especially when I'm rushing to get off to work in the morning, or when I'm super tired after a long day of work and then getting the kids to bed. No way would I be able to keep this up. I started off determined to try it for a few days to see if it made a difference, with the intention of cutting out the second step after I could determine if it whitened or not just as a time saver. After over a week of brushing morning and night with both Step one and two, I can confidently say that it really does work. My teeth are definitely whiter. Even better - it really wasn't hard to adjust my routine to include both steps. I've been able to keep it up all week without a problem and plan on keeping it up since it has been so easy.<br />And as a plus, it has helped reduce the gingival inflammation I've had since my last pregnancy, which means no more bleeding gums!<br />I do have to mention, that the hydrogen peroxide in Step 2 can make it a little abrasive. At first, I noticed actually more irritation and bleeding to my gums - but quickly learned it was because I was brushing too hard with it. (I've always been overzealous with brushing my teeth, which is my brushes look frayed after only a couple of months). As soon as I figured this out though, I've been able to adjust by brushing more lightly and carefully - I actually pay attention to what I'm doing while I'm brushing my teeth now instead of doing it automatically while thinking of a thousand other things. I think in the long run, this product has re-trained my to brush my teeth in a healthier way and will save the life of my toothbrushes, or at least help them to last a little longer. Thanks Crest!y while thinking of a thousand other things.   49. The Crest Pro-Health HD is a two-step system that claims to make your mouth 6 times healthier and your teeth 6 times whiter, than ordinary toothpaste, in just one week.<br /><br />The kit includes everything needed:<br />1 tube of purifying cleanser (step 1)<br />1 tube of perfecting gel (step 2)<br /><br />It is recommended that this product be used twice a day for the best results. You are directed to brush with the purifying cleanser for one minute. This strips away plaque. Then spit but do not rinse. Add the perfecting gel and brush for another minute. Then spit and rinse.<br /><br />You'll find the directions on the back of the package. Note that Crest offers a pre-paid card in the amount of your purchase if you aren't satisfied with the results. You'll want to keep your receipt and the UPC code in the event that you need to make a claim. You can visit their website for more details.<br /><br />I found that this product provided minimal results . It did make my mouth feel clean.   51. This is a two step toothpaste. Being two steps, this is something new that I'd never considered before. It's intended to be used in the morning & again at night. You're supposed to brush with each paste for one full minute each, with no rinsing in between. The first paste leaves my mouth feeling very dry but then you move on to the second paste, like a gel, really, and the dryness goes away. Once done, you can rinse & get on with your routine for the day. I really like the slick, shiny feeling this paste system gives my teeth. Although it claims 6x whitening, I can't really comment on that because I am not a heavy coffee or tea drinker, so I don't really notice staining on my teeth too much. That being said, I do feel that my teeth have gotten slightly whiter in eight days since I began using this system, if only by a few shades or so.<br /><br />I began using this system with a bit of hesitation because my mouth is somewhat sensitive to whitening toothpastes & gels and inevitably is affected, usually through drymouth, by such chemicals, but this paste seems to be different. I've been using it for over a week now with no adverse affects.<br /><br />I have two reasons why I might not use this again in the future. One is cost. I've done some looking around and this system seems to be a minimum of $12 on one website that I found, and up to as much as $38 on another. Even at $12, it's too expensive for me to use all the time. The second reason I might not use it again is the stannous fluoride which is in this paste system. I'm someone who really carefully considers what chemicals I expose myself and my family to and as such, I want to really look more closely into the dangers (if there are any) of stannous fluoride, before I would continue using Crest HD. I did receive a free trial product of Crest HD.

Preface: I received the Crest Pro-Health HD Daily Two-Step Toothpaste System as a free promotion from BzzAgent, in return for my unbiased opinion.<br /><br />Initially, I was a bit put off by the two tubes. The kit seemed far more serious than my normal tube of toothpaste. But, I’m a self-professed fresh breath junkie and I’m willing to try anything touted as “the biggest breakthrough in toothpaste since fluoride” if it will give me a whiter smile.<br /><br />The two-step process is simple. I brushed with the “purifying cleanser,” a gentle plaque-blaster, first. After a minute, and without rinsing, I brushed again for another minute with the “perfecting gel,” a clear gel polish. Easy enough.<br /><br />My teeth felt “fresh from the dentist” clean after two minutes, instead of 30 minutes in the dental hygienist chair. After a few days, my teeth are noticeably whiter. I have noticed a little more sensitivity in the area around my crown, but I think that is normal with any teeth-whitening product. I would highly recommend this product!
  59. I really like this system and I feel like it does a good job at both cleaning my teeth and whitening them. My only issue is that my teeth and gums are rather sensitive and this irritated them after about four days of continuous use. I simply cannot use every day instead I alternate using it with Crest Pro-Health toothpaste and have no issues. I received this fore review from Crest.
  60. I received the Crest Pro Health HD product as a promotion from BzzAgent to test and review. I was really excited to try this product because I generally use whitening products a few times per year to brighten and whiten my teeth. Crest Pro Health HD is a two step process. First you brush for a minute with the purifying cleanser which has a refreshing minty taste, then brush for another minute with the perfecting gel. This product is convenient because you are both cleaning and whitening your teeth in the two minute process. The first week I did not notice a change in the color of my teeth and was beginning to think the product was not working for me. I continued with using Crest Pro Health HD for a second week but really did not pay much attention to the color of my teeth. I was so surprised when I caught a reflection of my smile in the mirror-my teeth were so much whiter than when I started! For me, the results took a little bit of time to achieve, but I would compare them to the same results I receive when I use whitening strips. I love the results of whitening strips but I have two issues with them- I hate the tooth sensitivity that they give me and I don't like that they only whiten your front teeth. The Crest Pro Health HD product takes care of both of those problems. I didn't have any sensitivity and you are whitening all of your teeth. The best part is Crest Pro Health HD is much cheaper than the whitening strips I have used in the past. I definitely recommend this product if you are looking for a brighter and whiter smile!
  61. I have always had the kind of smile that never seems to get any brighter, no matter what products I use. I have tried all kinds of at-home whitening kits and religiously brush with whitening toothpaste. When I had the chance to sample Crest Pro Health HD for free, I figured it would be about the same as all of the other whitening products out there. But Crest Pro Health HD is the first toothpaste I have used that actually made a difference in the brightness of my smile. After using Crest Pro Health HD for just a couple of days I could see a difference. I continued to see my brightness improve the more I used it. However, I have repeatedly experienced discomfort, especially in the gum area, when using Crest Pro Health HD. The package warns that white spots may appear on the gums after using the brightening gel and I experienced those each time I used the product (though they disappeared within an hour). The whitening gel caused some stinging and slight gum pain for me each time I used it, but it didn't last beyond brushing. Overall, I am happy with the product because despite the discomfort, I am seeing results I am happy with. If the results are the most important thing for you, then I highly recommend Crest Pro Health HD.
  62. I've been using Crest Pro Health HD for a couple of weeks, thanks to a free kit from BzzAgent. Some things I love, some are just okay. Here's the scoop: the purifying cleanser is probably one of the best toothpastes I've ever used. You know how sometimes you brush your teeth in the morning only to feel like you have to brush them again 15 minutes later? Yeah, the purifying cleanser takes care of that. My mouth feels really clean after brushing, which I love.<br /><br />The perfecting gel, on the other hand, I was not so impressed with. I think maybe my teeth are a little whiter, but not noticeably. And while I do think my teeth look brighter right after I use it, a few hours later any difference has disappeared.<br /><br />Also, and I know this is a little thing, while the toothpaste has a flip cap, the perfecting gel has a twist-off, which means that you have to put down your toothbrush between step one and two to take off the cap for the gel. Listen, I said it was a little thing, but it is kinda annoying.<br /><br />All in all, great toothpaste, and I'll probably buy it just for step one. My mouth does feel cleaner for longer.

After using step one of the process for one minute, you spit but do not rinse your mouth. Then you continue to brush with step two of the product for an additional minute. We can not see a difference in his teeth either.   95. I have been using this routine for several weeks. First, there has been a slight whitening to my teeth and they feel nice which I love. So many times after step one I started rinsing my mouth and not just spitting before starting step 2. This sounds ridiculous but a habit that you have done your whole life is hard to change. I also found it messy. Unless you remembered to have the tube of whitener opened before you began step 1 you would have to set down your toothbrush without rinsing it while opening the second bottle. The first bottle/tube has a flip cap which is great for one hand use. But! the second bottle of whitener and polish is a large twist off cap. I believe the caps are different because the whitener polish/gel is runny. It is so runny that as soon as you twist off the cap the product starts running out of the tube. I felt like I was wasting it. So overall, my teeth definitely feel cleaner, whiter, and it's convinced me to switch over from my previous brand.   111. I was offered the oppertunity to try Crest ProHealth HD whitening toothpast as a BuzzAgent promotion. I was asked to try the toothpaste and simply share my honest reaction. I must be honest I would not normally purchase this product as I'm very particular about my dental hygene and following a pretty strick cleaning process. I have very sensitive teeth and they always overreact to whitening products. Additionally, I'm very careful about chemicals and thus prefer using Essential Oil cleansers. But, since the product was free, I decided to give it a try. You must do a two step process which really isn't that time consuming (1 minute cleaning with each tube). That proved easy enough but then you had to use the product for at least a week to determine if there was any difference. The taste is a strong mint which is acceptable in the tooth paste &#34;business&#34; but I prefer a less subtle taste. I always worry what they're masking with the added mint flavor. You mouth does indeed feel clean once you've used the product, but I get the same clean feething when using Theives essential oils so I wasn't overly impressed. Yes, I would tend to say that step one cleans better than a typical Crest product. The second step, the whitening gel, made my teeth and gums sensitive so I was hesitant to use much. I would venture to say that perhaps my teeth lightened a shade but it may also be simply because I kept staring at them and took more notice than normal. I don't drink coffee, wine, tea, or dark sodas so I don't have as much staining as perhaps others so there may simply just be less staining to &#34;erase&#34; if you will. I know that many others have high reviews of this product so perhaps I'm just the outlier but I would prefer to go back to my normal chemical free cleanse. I personally wouldn't spend the nearly $13 for this product. I would however say that if you're looking for a product to try, this one is significantly easier and less time consuming to use than white strips!rips!

Two small draw-backs: 1) storing Step 1 on it's cap (like it's apparently designed) causes a slight stringy mess when opening the cap, so I store it upside down & issue solved, 2) my gums are, as a norm, sensitive & this product did magnify that sensitivity on about day 2, but only for about 1 day. Also, my teeth were definitely noticeably whiter after about a week or so - definitely more noticeable than with other whitening toothpastes but with a lot less hassle than using things like whitening strips.<br /><br />I would say that I won't purchase this every time I buy toothpaste, but I probably will use it every other time to keep my teeth extra white and my mouth extra fresh!

  180. I've been using Crest Pro Health® HD for about a week now, thanks to a fantastic free sample I receive in the mail from Bzz Agent. Crest Pro Health® HD is a 2-step toothpaste system, each taking 1 minute to complete. Step 1 is a purifying cleanser that strips away plaque. It is a blue gel that I found was most similar to conventional toothpaste that I was used to. I applied it to my toothbrush, and brushed for 1 minute as directed. Although it did not &#34;foam&#34; as much as my conventional toothpaste, it had a similar pleasant fresh taste. After 1 minute, I spit out the cleanser (no rinsing), and then applied the perfecting gel, Step 2, to my toothbrush and brushed for 1 minute. The gel is a white gel that is designed polishes and whitens your teeth. it did not foam very much, and had a distinct minty taste, which was strong but very refreshing. I brushed for 1 minute, spit, and then rinsed my mouth.<br /><br />I followed this regimen for 1 week, and really liked the results I achieved with so little effort and variation from my normal routine. After each brushing session, my teeth and mouth felt so clean and my breath fresh. While my teeth did not become significantly whiter (I am an avid coffee drinker, so my teeth are not as white as they could be), I noticed an improvement in color. Best of all, my mouth felt fresh and clean, using such a user-friendly whitening regimen.<br /><br />Crest Pro Health® HD is a fantastic product that is so easy to use, takes practically no time at all, with such fantastic results. It was literally like brushing your teeth, but with the whitening benefits rolled into it. I've tried other whitening products such as other whitening toothpastes as well as whitening strips, and you really can't beat a 2 -minute cleaning AND whitening system! Thank you, Crest Pro Health® HD!

  203. I think Crest created quite the remarkable product with this 2-Step paste. It seems to be much more than that, though... This isn't your run-of-the-mill toothpaste that you routinely apply to your toothbrush and start brushing away like a zombie with twice a day. No, in fact, it feels like an oral spa treatment with each use. I was pretty skeptical when I read that improvements would include a few shades whiter in a week, but I have to admit, that even through smoking and drinking coffee daily, I did receive a noticeably whiter smile. I had nothing to lose as this was offered free by Crest to me as a promotional sample.<br /><br />The first step (brushing for 1 minute with gray tube) feels like a tooth/gum exfoliation treatment. The paste has a gritty and minty consistency to it (don't worry, it isn't uncomfortable or painful at all) and brushes off plaque with ease and leaves a minty aftertaste. After that one minute, you rinse the toothbrush (but not your mouth! Leave whatever paste is in your mouth) and apply a bit of the blue tube to your brush. Another minute of brushing with this paste will leave a euphorically clean sensation all around your mouth. Your teeth and gums will feel much slicker and smoother, and your tongue will have a clean, fresh feeling. It really eliminates any bad breath on the spot and you feel dentist-clean. What's more is that this second paste actually has a similar, if not identical taste that tooth whitening strips/paste have, so you know that this product is the real deal made from the same stuff!<br /><br />Even with this clean feeling, I did not notice a difference in the first 2 or 3 days. However, by the 7 or 8-day mark, there was a difference in the shade of my teeth (not astounding, but noticeable for sure), and now that I've been using this for close to a month, my teeth are even whiter still. Also, keep in mind I am still smoking, drinking coffee and wine, and this paste just keeps on helping to maintain the whitest smile my teeth can give.<br /><br />On the topic of bad morning breath, that is where I feel the product falls short. It hasn't helped with mine, but I attribute that to acid reflux and smoking, so I'm not sure that this product was designed to combat either of those. It will rid you of morning breath after you brush in the morning, but if you are expecting to wake up in the morning with minty breath, this product doesn't seem to offer that.<br /><br />In short, it works, you can feel it working, and with a little time you will see it working.eeth can give.<br /><br />On the topic of bad morning breath, that is where I feel the product falls short. My enamel is already going away and I'm afraid that this product will do it faster. White teeth is important to me but my enamel is more important. Also, unlike other tooth pastes, I don't get the crisps clean minty taste because it leaves a hydrogen peroxide foamy taste. Gross!
  207. I like this product - it adds another step to the traditional tooth brushing regime but I think the fresh, clean results are worth it. I wish the cap on Step 2 was not a twist off but that's my only gripe with the product. If you've ever washed your face with any St Ives Face Scrub and experienced the way your face feels super polished and buffed out, this is how your teeth will feel. I almost felt like I used a mild sand paper to buff out my teeth so you certainly will feel the difference right away - great for plaque removal. I tried this product free thanks to Crest. #BzzAgent

  220. I received Crest Pro Health HD for free from BzzAgent. I am really impressed by this product. First, the system: there are 2 tubes. The first one is the actual cleaner -- it's minty and tastes like normal toothpaste -- not quite as minty as the Crest Scope, but it still is refreshing. You have to brush for one minute with this paste. Then you spit, but don't rinse. And then you put the second paste on your toothbrush, and brush for one more minute with this one. This tube is a gel, clear, and it's the whitener/polisher. It also has a good flavor. Once you're done, you spit and rinse as usual. I have to say, after about 5 days of using this, I think my teeth are looking whiter. Not dramatically so, but there is definitely a difference in the brightness. I was worried about sensitivity, because I have sensitive teeth, but it has not bothered me at all. Another perk to this system is that is forces me to actually brush for a full 2 minutes -- as opposed to just a quick brush -- it makes me more conscious of using the 1st tube for about a minute, and then the second part. So that is an added benefit for sure! I've always used Crest Scope, but I would buy this toothpaste instead, especially if my teeth continue to whiten.
  221. This toothpaste made my mouth feel really clean and I noticed whiter teeth after just one use. The effects improve over time, but it's nice to get that initial boost right off the bat, so if you're heading out for a date or something, this will give you some impact just the first time. What I noticed most about this two step toothpaste was how clean my teeth felt after only one use. Like a fresh from the dentist kind of clean. I really liked how smooth my teeth felt from the polishing step. I have sensitive teeth, and while this isn't a toothpaste FOR sensitive teeth, it didn't aggravate or bother my teeth or gums at all. I would definitely buy this product, though I was provided a free sample to review.

  226. Despite the daily brushing of my teeth, the smile reflected back at me from my mirror was something I was less than pleased with. I had heard about whitening products, but thought they were either too pricey or took too much time to use. When Bzz Agent offered me a chance to try a product that could whiten my teeth as I brushed my teeth, I took up their offer immediately.<br /> When the package of Colgate Pro Health HD toothpaste arrived I noticed something different about this product than other products I had seen. Instead of mixing the whitening agent into the toothpaste and selling it as one product , I noticed that this product came in two separate tubes. To avoid confusion of which bottle to use first, not only were the tubes in different colors, but they are marked as &#34;STEP 1&#34; and &#34;STEP 2&#34;. The colorful packaging claimed to make my teeth healthier and whiter in a week, so I decided to take up the challenge and see for myself if this was true.<br /> Surprisingly, it took very little time to get adjusted to using two different tubes of toothpaste instead of one. The silver tube, &#34;STEP 1&#34;, was the &#34;purifying cleanser&#34; and used for taking off the plaque from the teeth. You are suppose to brush for one minute with this product and just spit it out, not rinse out your mouth and spit out. There is a slight minty taste to this light blue gel and your mouth will feel a little grainy after just spitting out &#34;STEP 1&#34;, but it will shortly go away when you have finished the next step. &#34;STEP 2&#34;, the blue tube, was the &#34;perfecting gel&#34; and it's job was to polish and whiten your teeth. This clear gel has more of a peppermint smell to it and after one minute of use you are suppose to rinse and spit it out.<br /> The verdict? After one week of using this product, not only have I noticed a whiter smile, but my family has as well. It feels normal having two separate tubes instead of one tube to use to brush my teeth with. My teeth feel cleaner and plaque forms less frequently on my teeth than it use to. I do wish that my mouth felt mintier and fresher though. My teeth may feel cleaner , but I feel more self conscious with my breath because the toothpaste needs to be a bit stronger in the mint department for my preferences.   238. As a big coffee drinker, I jumped at the chance to try out a promotional sample of the Crest HD teeth whitening products. The things that appealed to me about this product included the quick action whitening (with noticeable effects within a week), the emphasis on gingivitis reduction, and the relative ease of use. The product required simply two minutes of brushing; one minute with the purifying cleanser, and one minute with the perfecting gel. I found this system to be a much better alternative to whitening strips or other harsher whitening methods.<br /><br />Typically when I shop for toothpaste I am torn between \\"whitening\\" tooth pastes or overall oral health toothpastes. The great part about the Crest HD is you get the benefits of both products in one package. The majority of regular whitening toothpastes contain sodium fluoride as the activity ingredient for fighting cavities. The Crest HD product contains stannous fluoride as the active ingredient which not only helps prevent cavities, but also has antibacterial properties which helps fight plaque, protect against gingivitis, and helps reduce tooth sensitivity (beyond that of sodium fluoride). To me this is a win-win. You get overall improved oral health benefits and tooth whitening in one product. I have previously been told I have early stages of gingivitis so opting for a whitening product, which also contains stannous fluoride, combines exactly what I am looking for in a toothpaste.<br /><br />I used the product for one week following the steps on the package. I did notice a difference from the beginning in that my mouth did actually \\"feel\\" cleaner and healthier after brushing with the HD product compared to my regular toothpaste. After one week I noticed improvements in whitening but it is difficult to assess as a full 6x whiter. The taste of the step 1 toothpaste was as expected of any normal mint toothpaste. The gel used in Step 2 reminded me of the old gel fluoride treatments that dentists used to give after a cleaning. Personally, I find the taste of the gel a turnoff, but it would not prevent me from using the product in the future. I would recommend this product to others seeking a whitening toothpaste that also has the benefits of improving oral health.s used to give after a cleaning. Personally, I find the taste of the gel a turnoff, but it would not prevent me from using the product in the future. I would recommend this product to others seeking a whitening toothpaste that also has the benefits of improving oral health.

  241. For years, I paid for professional teeth whitening with my dentist. The first tube is used for one minute and cleans plaque from the teeth. After using step one, my teeth felt super clean. Step two is a one minute gel that whitens and polishes teeth. After using the second tube, my teeth felt smooth, much like leaving from my six month dental exam.<br /><br />What I did not like: First of all, the taste of the paste and gel leave much to be desired. This is a simple alternative and doesn't add any extra time to your daily routine (unless you don't brush your teeth).<br /><br />I also liked that this product did not cause the sensitivity issues I have had with other whitening products. This product is a great value for quick results.

You can almost feel little bubbles scrubbing decay away and then Step 2 (the gel) polishes your teeth and makes your mouth feel spotless.   260. I received the Crest Pro-Health HD for free, and just had to give it a try.<br /><br />First of all, there are two steps to its usage, but they are simple to follow. Step one, you brush your teeth with cleanser that is very similar to regular toothpaste for one minute to clean your teeth. Make sure you only spit after this first step without rinsing because you need to move on to step two. In step two you brush with a whitening solution for another minute. After one week, your teeth should be 6x white and 6x healthier.<br /><br />So, how did it go? Well, it went well. Here are some pros and cons.<br /><br />Cons: I didn't notice a huge improvement in whiteness, and the solutions left somewhat of a bad taste in my mouth. If you have sensitive teeth this may also hurt your gums or teeth for a little while.<br /><br />Pros: While there wasn't a huge improvement in whiteness, there was an improvement nonetheless. The idea that you had to brush for one minute with each step was also beneficial as it caused me to focus on the time versus just a quick (too-quick according to many dental studies) brush like I commonly did before.<br /><br />Overall, buy it and try it. It is not a miracle cure, but it is better than your average whitening toothpaste.

  264. So, first off, did Crest Pro Health HD make my teeth whiter? I think the answer to that is, &#34;yes&#34; (see before and after pics attached). Did it make my teeth &#34;6 shades whiter&#34;? I'll let you be the judge, but I think not.<br /><br />I drink a lot of coffee in any given day. I know that by the end of the day, my teeth (and breath) are in need of attention. I typically use Crest Pro Health toothpaste, because I like how clean it makes my mouth feel. Having an opportunity to try new Crest Pro Health HD through BzzAgent seemed ideal! I know my teeth could use some whitening, and using a brand I already know and like? Yay!<br /><br />The two-step system is pretty simple, except for one little thing. One is advised to use each of the two products for one minute each, but I use a Sonicare toothbrush that is programmed with a two-minute brush cycle. I can turn it off early, but I would feel like I wasn't cleaning my teeth properly. So I ended up using each product for two minutes each. Four minutes has never felt SO LONG. It sounds ridiculous, but it's true. 4 minutes of tooth brushing is pretty excessive.<br /><br />The Step 1 product I like a lot. The taste is good, and it makes my mouth feel fresh and clean (as does Crest Pro Health toothpaste in, um...regular definition, I guess). Step 2? It's basically hydrogen peroxide in a gel suspension with artificial sweetener added. You know how peroxide fizzes and gives a sort of burning sting on contact? It's pretty much the same thing in your mouth. It's not unbearably unpleasant, but I can't say it's great. The tip of my tongue sometimes felt a bit of a burn while using it (though this ended immediately upon rinsing). The white spots one is warned of on the label on gums and soft tissue DO appear, but I wasn't alarmed at all since I'm well aware of how hydrogen peroxide operates. TOTALLY harmless, and disappears quickly--so no worries--but in the interest of full disclosure... My husband tried it once and hated the taste--didn't use it again. I didn't mind it that much, and I have used both steps for about a week and a half now. I haven't noticed dramatic continued whitening beyond that of the first few uses, but it cleans my teeth well.<br /><br />The good news is, it did seem to whiten my teeth a bit, which I am always happy about--and I didn't experience any increase in the sensitivity of my teeth to heat/cold at all. The bad news is, I'm not sure this is a perfect system for everyone. Two steps means more on the bathroom counter (or to pack in a travel case), more time spent brushing one's teeth (I have 3 young kids, so I sometimes feel lucky to manage the basics of personal hygiene), and the whole slight fizzing issue... Overall, I say it's worth a try--and you can see the pictures of my results below. The first picture I featured is my teeth at the end of the day before brushing at all (nasty and yellowed from my caffeine habit), while the second is my teeth after using Crest Pro Health HD for a full week, twice daily. No filters, same lighting, etc. I wanted to include this to let anyone considering Crest Pro Health HD judge for themselves the results. $16 retail for the 2 step system isn't a big investment for teeth whitening, though it is pretty expensive for toothpaste. I will use all of the Crest Pro Health HD system until it's gone, but after that I will likely return to the single step Crest Pro Health Whitening paste that I like best.tried it once and hated the taste--didn't use it again. I didn't mind it that much, and I have used both steps for about a week and a half now. I haven't noticed dramatic continued whitening beyond that of the first few uses, but it cleans my teeth well.<br /><br />The good news is, it did seem to whiten my teeth a bit, which I am always happy about--and I didn't experience any increase in the sensitivity of my teeth to heat/cold at all. The bad news is, I'm not sure this is a perfect system for everyone. Two steps means more on the bathroom counter (or to pack in a travel case), more time spent brushing one's teeth (I have 3 young kids, so I sometimes feel lucky to manage the basics of personal hygiene), and the whole slight fizzing issue... Overall, I say it's worth a try--and you can see the pictures of my results below. The first picture I featured is my teeth at the end of the day before brushing at all (nasty and yellowed from my caffeine habit), while the second is my teeth after using Crest Pro Health HD for a full week, twice daily. No filters, same lighting, etc. I wanted to include this to let anyone considering Crest Pro Health HD judge for themselves the results. $16 retail for the 2 step system isn't a big investment for teeth whitening, though it is pretty expensive for toothpaste. I will use all of the Crest Pro Health HD system until it's gone, but after that I will likely return to the single step Crest Pro Health Whitening paste that I like best.

  278. So, as a BzzAgent, I was really excited to try this product for free. Whiter teeth without trays or strips in a week? Excellent! First, the paste tastes really chalky in your mouth when you're brushing. I'm not sure if it's the different fluoride or the whitening formulation, but...ick. Not a fan. Second, brushing your teeth for two minutes is probably what everyone should be doing regardless of what toothpaste they're using, but it feels like a *really* long time, especially when you're tired and want to go to bed. (See above note about being a mom of two.) Third, and perhaps most importantly, the toothpaste has given me two large canker sores in my mouth. Nothing else about my diet or health has changed, so I have to assume it's from changing my toothpaste. I've since discontinued use of the product and doubt I will use it in the future because of this. So, in sum, it definitely whitens your teeth, but if you get canker sores in your mouth, maybe steer clear.

  295. When I first heard Crest was coming out with something new and revolutionary, I thought to myself, \\"what can be revolutionary about a toothpaste?\\" If you're thinking the same thing, let me tell assure you: Crest Pro-Health HD is unlike anything I've ever tried before. I started using it just over a week ago, and I've been very happy with the way my teeth have felt. If you've ever left the dentist wondering why your teeth can't feel that clean every day, I would strongly consider giving this toothpaste a try, because somehow it manages to do exactly that.<br /><br />Step 1 is a purifying cleanser, and it is a much more abrasive formula than your average, slightly chalky toothpaste. I had no problems at all remembering to only use this for a minute, because it leaves a residue on your teeth and a dry, almost numb fluoride feeling that lets you know you're ready to spit it out and move on to step 2. You aren't supposed to rinse your mouth between steps, and it's easy to understand why once you've used the system: step 2 is a smooth gel, and once you start brushing with it, you really begin to feel that great, clean feeling as it polishes your teeth. The whole process only takes two minutes total, and you don't need to use very much of each product when compared to regular toothpaste.<br /><br />This really is a life-changer for me: I thought this might be a gimmicky product, but at this point I can't imagine using regular toothpaste again. Thank you, Crest!<br /><br />Note: I received a free product for the purpose of my review. Opinions are 100% my own.

The clean feeling seems to last longer with this toothpaste than with others and I feel like my teeth do look whiter, although no one has commented on it yet. I was glad that I could try out the Crest Pro Health HD two step system for BzzAgent. It is a really simple two step system: first you brush your teeth with the step 1 toothpaste followed by step 2 by adding the whitening gel to your toothbrush and brush for about one minute. This is so much more easy to do and to use than the whitening strips or other whitening systems because you don't have to wait half an hour or longer to see the results. The package says 6X whiter teeth after a week versus ordinary toothpaste. I assume they mean non-whitening, but who knows what they mean. And 6X whiter? Any way, it just did not help me.<br /><br />The toothpaste comes in two tubes. I followed the directions very carefully. I used one for a minute and then tube two for a minute. I made sure not to rinse my mouth in between.<br /><br />The first tubes active ingredients are Stannous Fluoride 0.454%. The second tube lists full ingredients of Water, Glycerin, Hydrogen Peroxide, Carbomer, Disodium Pryophosphate, Flavor, Sucralose, Sodium Hydroxide. The whitener is just standard Hydrogen Peroxide in a gel.<br /><br />After using it I feel this product is no better, nor worse than any other whitening toothpaste.<br /><br />Full disclosure, I got this product free from Crest, via the Bzz marketing company, and to continue receiving products I need to submit reviews.   312. I received Crest Pro Health HD to sample and review, for no charge. One week in and, yes, I can see a difference. My teeth were quite white already, but I can still tell a difference. It is a two step process. Brush with Step 1, which is a purifying cleanser that strips away plaque (who wouldn't want that!?!), for one minute. Then spit but DO NOT rinse. Add Step 2 to your brush - the whitening & polishing gel - for an additional minute. Then spit and rinse. Two minutes to a clean, sparkling smile. It feels a bit like I've just walked out of the dentist office. I have an electric toothbrush so it's easy to know when each minute is up. Only complaint - I normally scrub my tongue at the end of the two minutes, but the whitening gel (obviously) isn't meant for the tongue. My solution is simply to brush my tongue at the end of Step 1 and again after I rinse after Step 2. If you're trying to whiten your smile, give this a shot!

  327. That feeling right when you leave your dentist after having your teeth cleaned. That's what I am getting with the Crest Pro-Health HD system. Second, you spit but don't rinse from Step 1, and then brush for another minute using the second, blue tube. The second tube has a clear gel that has peroxide as one of its ingredients, and you see the bubblies on your teeth and between the teeth as you brush. I do feel that my teeth and gums look and feel healthy, I just which sensitivity was not a side effect. I still would prefer the convenience of a two in one toothpaste versus a two step system.<br /><br />I tried this product free thanks to Crest and Bzzagent.
  349. I got this product free from participating with BzzAgent. Not a big fan of the 'system'. I didn't notice any difference in the whiteness of my teeth. Not a big fan of peppermint, would prefer a spearmint version. The one big issue I have is that tube 1 has a flip top (great!), but the 2nd tube is a twist cap. Doesn't seem to be a problem at first thought, until you are in the middle of brushing. So you finish the first step, and your toothbrush (and maybe your had) is wet, and now you need to hands to hold the 2nd tube and twist the top off. But I don't want to set my wet brush down anywhere, so either you try to twist with one hand, or keep the brush in your mouth, or put it in a cup or something. Would have been much easier to put the flip cap on the 2nd tube as well, which is much easier to do with one hand.
  350. I had the opportunity to try Crest Pro-Health HD for free through BzzAgent. When I first received my package, I was curious. Why would I ever need two toothpastes? Granted, one tube is technically a &#34;whitening gel,&#34; but I brush my teeth with it all the same.<br /><br />The first night I followed the instructions exactly. One minute with Step 1, the plaque-removing toothpaste, and one minute with Step 2, the whitening gel. I use a Sonicare toothbrush and am used to brushing each of my four quadrants for 30 seconds at a time, so I found myself annoyed and feeling rushed. My mouth was getting the same total amount of brushing, but it was two rounds of hasty brushing instead of one round of thorough brushing. I wasn't impressed and decided to change it up going forward by doing a full two minutes on Step 1 followed by a minute with Step 2. It seems a little ridiculous brushing my teeth for three minutes now, but at least my teeth feel clean.<br /><br />Here are the positives. I absolutely love the flavor of the Step 1 toothpaste. It's a strong, wintergreen sort of flavor. It makes my mouth feel fresh and clean. The formula of Step 1 also does an amazing job making my teeth feel extra clean. That's not just because I brush for longer than the recommendation, either -- even when I followed the directions, I felt like my teeth were smoother and cleaner than when I use a regular toothpaste. The strong flavor also helps to cover up the flavor of Step 2, which is why I'm guessing it's so strong and they tell you not to rinse between the steps.<br /><br />As for the negatives, well, I really don't think my teeth are 6 times whiter. I honestly haven't really noticed anything perceptible, though maybe that's because my teeth weren't horrendously yellow to begin with. My husband has been using it as well, and he has noticed a considerable difference in his teeth, so maybe it's just me. I wouldn't want to use Step 1 without also using Step 2, as the active ingredient in Step 1 is known to cause yellowing of the teeth. It's kind of convenient that Crest has chosen to minimize that side effect through including a whitening agent. The Step 2 also tastes terrible if you accidentally rinse out your mouth from Step 1 before you start. Hydrogen peroxide is not a pleasant flavor.<br /><br />I also think the cost is a bit extreme. It cleans well, but would I really want to pay over $10 whenever I need toothpaste? I don't think it's amazing enough to justify the cost. I also am bothered that there are essentially two products but you can't purchase them separately. When you inevitably run out of one before the other, you're going to have to go buy both. Product will go to waste. I'm not a fan of that. I also just can't get myself into the routine of remembering to use two different products. Often I rinse before realizing I still need Step 2, and on a couple of occasions where I've been very tired, I've accidentally skipped Step 2 altogether.<br /><br />If you can get a good deal on this, or you have really yellow teeth you'd like to clean up during your daily toothbrushing routine, it might be worth a try. I'm not wowed though.ngredient in Step 1 is known to cause yellowing of the teeth. It's kind of convenient that Crest has chosen to minimize that side effect through including a whitening agent. The Step 2 also tastes terrible if you accidentally rinse out your mouth from Step 1 before you start. Hydrogen peroxide is not a pleasant flavor.<br /><br />I also think the cost is a bit extreme. It cleans well, but would I really want to pay over $10 whenever I need toothpaste? I don't think it's amazing enough to justify the cost. I also am bothered that there are essentially two products but you can't purchase them separately. When you inevitably run out of one before the other, you're going to have to go buy both. Product will go to waste. I'm not a fan of that. I also just can't get myself into the routine of remembering to use two different products. Often I rinse before realizing I still need Step 2, and on a couple of occasions where I've been very tired, I've accidentally skipped Step 2 altogether.<br /><br />If you can get a good deal on this, or you have really yellow teeth you'd like to clean up during your daily toothbrushing routine, it might be worth a try. I'm not wowed though.

  353. I got a Crest Pro Health HD from being a member of BzzAgent and from Crest, so I could review it. I've been using it for about three weeks and overall am pretty impressed. Its simple and quick to use, and only involves two steps. Step 1 is a sort of blue toothpaste to first clean off all of the plaque and bacteria in your mouth, and had a pleasant minty taste and texture. You brush with it for one minute then spit it out, not rinsing. Then you brush with Step 2 for the same amount of time. Step 2 is a clear gel with peroxide to whiten the teeth. I don't like the second step as much as the first because it doesn't taste as much and looks like glue. But I like how convenient and simple it is to able to just use these in lieu of your normal toothpaste everyday and how quick it is (only two minutes, one minute for brushing each step). Another thing I liked was how the directions were very clearly written on the backs of both tubes so you didn't have to keep the box. On the first day, I didn't see much of a difference in the whiteness of my teeth but they did feel clean. After using it for as long as I have I can see how bright they've become.

  409. As part of a free trial pack, I received the Crest Pro Health HD pack a few weeks ago. My first couple of brushings, I was expecting more action, but I started out using smaller amounts than I might normally. I didn't want to overwhelm my mouth, so I slowly worked up in amounts of toothpaste from there until I could feel an effect.<br />The Step 1 is a fairly mild flavor, I assume to not offend different tastes. Too little, and it loses the flavor quickly, but hitting the tipping point and it lasts for the full brushing.<br />Step 2, at lessor amounts, was hard to even notice anything else was there. The flavor was a little more astringent, but not bad. As the amounts increased, finally hitting that &#34;sweet spot&#34;, I could feel it taking it's effect. Not bad, just noticeable.<br />You might think to use half the amount of toothpaste on each step, equaling a full amount you might normally. But instead, think of these as two separate brushings, each requiring the full amount(give or take a bit) that you would normally. This is where I was initially unimpressed, then as the amounts increased, so did my opinion on the product.<br />One question I saw being asked was, is this an every-day toothpaste. For myself, I think the answer is no. I don't have generally sensitive teeth, but there are some spots that are responding a little more sensitively than I'd like. I think, unless you're a heavy smoker/coffee drinker, you probably don't need it all of the time anyway. Once you get the base staining taken care of, you can let your mouth rest, and just start an upkeep routine mixed with your normal brushing cycle. This is purely my opinion on the matter, as I have no official answers to relay.<br />To the questions of does this actually work, I have to say most definitely. In just the two weeks of brushing, even starting slow and working my way up, I've seen noticeable improvements in the color of my teeth. Due to the sensitive spots(probably due to recent dentist cleaning), I had to stop for a little while, but the old staining is not returning. Step 1 does a great job of cleaning initially, which helps Step 2 get to all of those places that are harder to reach.<br /><br />The price of $38 that I'm seeing around(unsure on Amazon's final price), would make me choke on my toothbrush if it were my normal daily toothpaste. However, now having my initial cleanings/whitenings completed, I can stomach that price tag for a weekly maintenance for myself.<br />My only caution would be those with either sensitive teeth, or sensitive gums/areas, is to take it slow. Start off with smaller amounts initially, and work up to your comfort level. Instructions/suggestions to this matter would help really round out the product, and would prompt me to update to 5 stars.<br /><br />In short, if you are at all considering a whitening product for your teeth, this would be the one I suggest. A very simple substitution for your normal brushing routine, and you're on your way to a whiter brighter future.dentist cleaning), I had to stop for a little while, but the old staining is not returning. Step 1 does a great job of cleaning initially, which helps Step 2 get to all of those places that are harder to reach.<br /><br />The price of $38 that I'm seeing around(unsure on Amazon's final price), would make me choke on my toothbrush if it were my normal daily toothpaste. However, now having my initial cleanings/whitenings completed, I can stomach that price tag for a weekly maintenance for myself.<br />My only caution would be those with either sensitive teeth, or sensitive gums/areas, is to take it slow. Start off with smaller amounts initially, and work up to your comfort level. Instructions/suggestions to this matter would help really round out the product, and would prompt me to update to 5 stars.<br /><br />In short, if you are at all considering a whitening product for your teeth, this would be the one I suggest. A very simple substitution for your normal brushing routine, and you're on your way to a whiter brighter future.

  426. I received the Crest ProHealth HD two-step toothpaste system as a member of BzzAgent, and I have not gone back to my Tom's since. Since my toothbrush already operates in a 2 minute cycle (it buzzes every 30 seconds so you know to change quadrants and then double buzzes at the end of the 2 minutes so you know you're done) it wasn't a challenge to brush for the full 2 minutes. But it's a pain (read: I feel like it lessens the battery life of my toothbrush) to start and stop it mid-cycle when I am switching between steps 1 and 2. The alternative is to just stop brushing and put the step 2 on while it's buzzing but you just lose a few seconds. Sounds nitpicky but it's definitely an extra step and you lose something - either time of brushing or battery life - along the way.<br /><br />But that's truly my only complaint! I really enjoy the step 1 paste - like the taste of it, how clean my teeth feel afterwards, and the overall feel. Step 2's taste took a little getting used to - it is more medicinal/typical of other whitening products I have used, such as Crest White Strips - but I don't notice anything off-putting now and love that it has whitened my teeth.

  429. I was so excited when I saw the BzzAgent campaign for Crest Pro Health® HD and was able to try this product as part of a promotion. After reading through the directions, I was a little concerned about not being able to spit during the two minutes I was required to brush my teeth because I usually do a few times but I decided to give it a go. How it works is you brush your teeth with Step 1, the purifying cleanser, for one minute and then add Step 2, the perfecting gel to your toothbrush without rinsing or spitting, and brush for another minute. The tubes are clearly labeled so there is no concern about mixing up which tube goes first and two minutes is the recommended brushing time. I put Step 1 on my toothbrush and began brushing. I use a Sonicare (electric toothbrush) to brush my teeth and it is awkward having to turn the toothbrush off to add Step 2 but that is what I did. One nice thing is my Sonicare has a built in timer for two minutes. When that time is up the toothbrush turns off. Even when I turn it off briefly to add Step 2, it still keeps track of my two minutes. I was a little relieved when the two minutes was up and I could finally spit!! The taste of the toothpaste and the gel are not bad. I wish they were a stronger mint flavor but at least they are not chalky. I have been using Crest Pro Health® HD for about two weeks now and I am very pleased with the results. My teeth have definitely become whiter and the stains are becoming less noticeable. I am getting compliments from people about how great my teeth look and I am smiling with more confidence. Overall, I enjoy using Crest Pro Health® HD, would buy it and use it again, and would recommend Crest Pro Health® HD to my friends and family. The “not spitting” and stopping to add the second step to my toothbrush are not so awkward anymore and have just become a part of my natural routine. It is definitely easier that putting the strips on my teeth.   433. I was super skeptical when Crest generously sent me a sample of the Pro Health HD to try. It seemed weird to me, to have to brush my teeth in two steps. Well, fear not! It's actually very painless. It's just a matter of putting the toothpaste (step 1) on the brush, brushing halfway (1 minute), spitting it out without rinsing your mouth, then putting the whitening gel (step 2) on the brush and brushing for a minute. It literally takes about 4 seconds longer than if you were brushing with a traditional toothpaste. I noticed my teeth lightening up by the third day, and that's no exaggeration. By the end of two weeks, my teeth were noticeably whiter! The best part is I didn't even have to use strips or trays (which I hate using, but are the only things that ever seem to work).   435. I wish I could say that I liked the Crest® 3D White™ Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System... I've always wanted to try a whitening product, but never have because of the price. The pain continued for a few days and I mentioned it to my husband. He suggested it could be from the harsh whitening products, that it probably stripped whatever protection I had, causing them to become sensitive again. I bought the Crest sensitivity toothpaste, started using it instead of the Crest® 3D White™ Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System toothpaste and felt a difference within a day or so of use. The only thing I can think is that my husband was right that it stripped my teeth during those two weeks of use. Because of this I unfortunately will not be recommending this to anyone or continuing to use it. I am disappointed to be sure, but for anyone out there with a history of sensitivity, this may not be the product for you!

I loved step 2 as it made my teeth feel super clean which I assume is why they made step 1 as step 1 makes your teeth feel very rough. I liked how step 2 actually did help make my teeth more white as well. I feel like anyone can you their own toothpaste preference for step 1 and then use the step 2 product for whitening. I am also not a fan that Crest has not removed the blue micro beads in their toothpastes. This beads get stuck in your gums and do not deteriorate. Another reason why I axed the step 1 toothpaste. Also how does Crest expect for someone to really use 2 toothpastes, when most people barely even use one! Just curious. I don't think this product is going to last long on the market especially for $12. It was a good thought, and ok product, but it is not something I would go out and buy when I can use my favorite toothpaste and my whiten trays/whitening strips than use two toothpastes.

  451. Full disclosure: I received a free sample of this courtesy of Crest (thanks Crest!), but, rest assured, my review is exactly as it would be if I'd bought it with my own hard-earned.<br /><br />First off, if you're wondering about the two-step process, it's not that big a deal. I have a heck of a time getting up and out of the house in the morning, and the extra step is really not a big deal at all. After the first few days, I noticed my gums were a little sore. I actually found myself trying to remember if I'd recently replaced the brush head on my Sonicare, and if maybe I'd bought a firmer brush. I realized I hadn't done that, so I think it might have been the paste - however, I traveled for a couple days and used whatever I had in a TSA-friendly little tube, and when I came home and went back to the HD, all was fine. No sore gums since.<br /><br />What I really like about this is the right-from-the-dentist feeling it gives me. And the feeling lasts throughout the day. I think my teeth are looking pretty nice and white, too. (without that unnatural glowing white look that some people get these days, from whatever they're using).
  452. The biggest bonus of this product is the clean/fresh feeling that you get after using it. I haven't experienced that with any other oral hygiene product and for someone who loves oral hygiene, that's a pretty big bonus. The downside? 2 steps. Most people don't even take the necessary 2 minutes you're supposed to spend on your teeth, so adding an extra step is a real-life deterrent. I actually do take the full 2 minutes (most times) and I even felt the 2 step thing grind on my nerves a bit. Some days I didn't even do it because it was a hassle. However, when I did consistently use it, I noticed several people (including my dental hygienist!) tell me my teeth looked really white. I regularly use another competing whitening toothpaste and received this to try for free, so I'm not sure if it's because it whitens better or just does a better job of creating a more brilliant luster. Either way, you get positive results and the clean feeling is a really positive bonus - enough to deal with 2 steps in the end.

No more losing the cap!<br /><br />The first I used as a traditional paste and brushed with it for one minute. It made my teeth feel squeaky clean. The directions told me not to rinse, but to spit and immediately apply the gel of the second tube to my tooth brush. This agent didn't foam as much as the first. After one minute of brushing with Step 2, I rinsed. My mouth felt noticeably cleaner with these two steps than with my usual tooth paste (Sensodyne).<br /><br />After using the Crest Pro Health for this paste month, I have experienced no increase in tooth sensitivity, but I also have not seen any increase in whiteness. The dual step program does seem to encourage me to brush for longer, but I until I hear word from my dentist, I don't believe this tooth paste is exceptional in whitening properties (I do regret not taking before/after photos). I was impressed with the fact that the 2-step system has produced a very positive change in my tooth brushing habits.   476. So I received the Crest HD toothpaste for free to try through bzzagent. I'm a dentist, and I have always been a very loyal Colgate total user. I was not a fan of the crest prohealth toothpaste because the after taste.<br /><br />The basics: two step system - step 1 has the active ingredient in it. The stuff that really cleans the teeth. It is the same stuff that's in crest prohealth. Use this step for one minute. Spit the excess out. Step 2- the &#34;polishing&#34; step. Has similar ingredients to other whitening toothpastes. Spit and rinse.<br /><br />The pros--- as a dentist, it's great that it gets people to brush for 2 minutes. It definitely has left my mouth feeling very clean. The bad aftertaste from the prohealth that I disliked is gone after using the second step. I do believe my mouth feels cleaner and smoother...even more than my Colgate total. (Never thought I'd say that being a loyal Colgate user)<br /><br />The cons-- initially, I wasn't a big fan of the taste of the second step but I've totally gotten used to that. Whitening toothpastes don't really whiten the internal part of your tooth. They are better at removing the surface staining. Read the fine print...they all say that. Whitening is dependent upon concentration and time. So you really aren't going to get whitening from any toothpaste. If you want true whitening you should see your dentist for bleach trays or use white strips like crest white strips.<br /><br />Overall-- a great toothpaste that leaves your teeth feeling very clean and polished. Not going to leave you with whiter teeth in my opinion. I'll add to the review later if I see results.

I received a full sized product as part of te BZZ Agent campaign going on right now.<br />I was eager to try tis product solely because of the reputation of the Crest brand and was looking forward to great results.<br />Unfortunately the second I put the first step in my mouth, I knew it was over. I moved onto step two.. this is the whitening part. It does nothing to freshen your mouth after the first step or even as a good tooth brushing would. It did not even hydrate my poor puckered mouth. My teeth did feel polished. Most likely fro the first step grit.<br />I was going to continue a few more days, until I was warned by a dental hygienist that the active ingredient in step 2 could actually stain my teeth! What is the point?<br />That was it. The entire kit was tossed in the trash. I would have done the same if I had paid full price for it.   494. I have always been self conscious about my smile. I've used my fare share of toothpastes from various brands.   495. This is a two-step process, and the two tubes are clearly labeled and are easy to use. You use each step for two minutes and don't rinse between steps.<br /><br />Step 1, the cleaner:<br />The good:<br />I like the taste, scent, consistency, and mouth feel.<br />The OK:<br />I'm not sure how different it is from other gel toothpastes.<br /><br />Step 2, the whitener:<br />The good:<br />The whitening gel is thick enough to stay on the toothbrush and is easy to apply.<br />The not so good:<br />My gums where I use the product in step 2, which is the front area of my top and bottom teeth, are very sensitive and uncomfortably tingly for about a half hour after I finish the process. At that point they are still sensitive, but it starts to subside.<br />It is not a strong burning feeling, but definitely not comfortable. After about an hour the discomfort has subsided, but the gum area around the teeth is white for about another hour.<br />I realize that whitening agents often cause tingling and discomfort. My gums are generally sensitive, and this issue may not happen to everyone.<br />If not for the discomfort from the whitening gel, I would have rated this product at 5 stars.<br /><br />The very good:<br />After the hour of discomfort has passed, my mouth feels clean and refreshed. The best part is that my teeth are noticeably less dingy and less beige. I actually noticed a slight difference in the look of my teeth after just two days. My teeth are not really yellow anyway, but they are certainly brighter and have a better hue after using this product for a week.<br /><br />In general, the brushing with each step for two minutes twice daily seems to be an appropriate time for good results.<br /><br />I have been using this product for seven days in a row.<br />I have used it with both a manual toothbrush and an ultrasonic model.<br />I do not use an oral irrigator, mouthwash, or eat / drink for at least an hour after using the product. This is just for my testing period.<br />When my testing is complete, I plan to continue to use this product, providing my gum sensitivity does not worsen.<br />I will most likely use step 1 twice daily, and use step 2 just once, to assure my gums are not overly irritated.<br /><br />Note:<br />I am a BzzAgent and received the product at no charge. I am not obligated to give a positive review, and my evaluation is honest and is based on my own personal experience.ng period.<br />When my testing is complete, I plan to continue to use this product, providing my gum sensitivity does not worsen.<br />I will most likely use step 1 twice daily, and use step 2 just once, to assure my gums are not overly irritated.<br /><br />Note:<br />I am a BzzAgent and received the product at no charge.   503. I would like to provide my review of the Crest Pro Health HD teeth whitening system. I should start by saying that I have been a Crest Pro Health user for quite some time now. And, over the years, I have used two different Crest teeth whitening strips. And, while I have always used Crest and been satisfied with their products, I was not a big fan of the whitening strips. I personally don't find them to be convenient.<br /><br />After receiving a sample of this product as part of a promotion, I captured two images of the packaging - one of the kit itself and one of the two tubes. Why two tubes? There are two steps to this whitening process. Step One is a cleaning process with stannous fluoride for gingivitis reduction. The substance looks a lot like a normal toothpaste. It is blue in color and is a bit thicker than my standard toothpaste. Step Two is the whitener, which is a clear substance.<br /><br />The instructions indicate you should use Step One for one minute, then rinse your brush BUT not your mouth, then use Step Two for one minute. This surprised me a bit because I brush longer than two minutes. So, I found myself brushing with Step One a bit longer than directed, maybe an extra minute. Because the taste of Step One was pleasant, I did not feel rushed or anxious to get to Step Two.<br /><br />When applying Step Two to the brush, I learned to use caution when squeezing from the tube because the substance comes out from the tube much quicker and easier than with Step One. I found Step Two to taste very much like the same substance used with the Crest whitening strips. Because I had cleaned my teeth already, I used a light brushing motion with Step Two, gently applying the whitener to my teeth. After one minute of brushing, I would rinse my mouth and brush.<br /><br />Crest claims to give you a 6x healthier mouth and 6x brighter smile after using the system for one week. I did use the product for a solid week and probably all but one day. I don't think I had a 6x whiter smile, but there is no question my smile was/is a few shades whiter. I absolutely feel like my mouth is healthier with this toothpaste. I'm not sure if I'd feel that way if I only used the one minute of brushing as directed by Crest, however.<br /><br />Amazon sells this product for nearly $28, which is less than a Crest white strips pack. Plus, you're getting the toothpaste here as well. I think this is a fairly-priced product that gets the job done. And, when you are talking about personal appearance and hygiene, the Pro Health HD from Crest has proven to be a reliable product.<br /><br />I had my wife try the whitener for two days. Her smile is already perfect, so she doesn't need much help. I was a little skeptical that the 2 step system would be complicated, but it was actually very simple- one minute with step one, one minute with step two. Step one felt like a typical toothpaste, but it did feel like it was cleaning. Step two was slicker and smoother. Both tasted fine, and went well together. I did actually have a dentist appointment about a week after I started this regimen, and the dentist asked what I was using, so something must have been noticeable. I am not sure whether it whitened any more than other whiteners, since it seems like most toothpaste nowadays does that, but my teeth felt clean and smooth, and my wife likes how I taste, so a winner in my book.
  532. I have sensitive gums and this toothpaste did not irriateate my gums. Most whitening toothpasts will do that. I like the cleansing feel that you get after step one followed by the whitening in step 2. I would recommend this for anyone with sensitive gums looking for a whitening toothpaste. I did receive a free sample for Bzzagent.

  537. I've always been a loyal Aquafresh user, but when BuzzAgent gave me the change to try this out as part of a promotional campaign, I was curious. What makes this product unique, as the name says, is that it is a two-step process designed to get teeth both cleaner (by stripping away plaque) and whiter (by polishing teeth). So far based on my experience it does seem to, in fact, do both (although I have yet to have a dental cleaning so whether my dentist says anything will be the true test for me). At first I will admit I wasn't crazy about the two step process since I really, really don't enjoy brushing my teeth. At first it did take some time to get used to, but after a couple of weeks it felt like second nature. For me the reason to keep doing it was how my teeth look and feel. I do agree with previous reviewers that I'm not sure this whitens dramatically better than other whitening toothpastes. I've found that if I want really, really white teeth nothing beats the system I got from my dentist (mouthpiece + whitening solution). However, I still like to use a whitening toothpaste for maintenance when I'm not actively whitening my teeth with the dentist's system and this is perfect for that. What I've enjoyed the most is how clean my teeth feel. It's hard to describe, but when I run tongue over them they feel really smooth and clean, almost like when I've just had them cleaned at the dentist. I also haven't found the taste of these products to be off-putting, which is a big plus.<br /><br />So far I've really liked these. As mentioned the true test will come when I have my next appointment but for now I'm pleased.

There is that old saying, &#34;The tingling means that it is working,&#34; and you can tell that this toothpaste is working. When applying Stage 1, the instructions note to brush for 1 minute and not to rinse. Rinsing is tempting, as the toothpaste is very gritty and sticks to your teeth. Stage 2 is the whitening gel that must also be brushed for 1 minute. I was happy that the gel did not have an overtly chemical taste. I give this product points for very easy instructions and not a long time commitment to use. I used this duo twice a day for 7 days. The box claims that I will have 6x whiter teeth in 1 week. I barely notice a difference. But, my teeth feel remarkably smooth and clean. My only concern for this product is that I feel the toothpaste is very harsh. The gum line on one of my teeth seems to have started to recede ever so slightly which is something I will need to speak to my dentist about.   545. I received this through BzzAgent. All opinions are my own. I though the product was decent for what it claims to do. I had been using a standard whitening toothpaste that didn't seem to be doing much on it's own, but I'm generally skeptical of whitening claims in general. Step 1 of this product really did leave my mouth feeling clean. I certainly felt that dry mouth feeling that others have mentioned, but it went away completely with Step 1. I alternate between a regular toothbrush and an electric, and I used less of the product with my electric toothbrush (about a pea sized amount). And, since I'm neurotic, I would brush for 2 minutes for each Step when using the electric. I didn't mind not being able to rinse my mouth out between steps, but it did bother me that I would brush my tongue after Step 1, and then have to rinse my toothbrush before Step 2 (which I feel like would defeat the purpose of not rinsing - it wiped out most of the residue I assume you want on your teeth before the whitening step). Step 2 was your average whitener. It didn't bother my gums or teeth but would on occasion tingle or have a slight burn. My teeth felt sparkling clean after both of these steps, but I was in the bathroom for about 10 minutes when all was said and done :) I think the price is slightly high for a toothpaste, especially if you just buy a standard one with baking soda. I liked that it did not seem abrasive to my teeth, but I don't know that it really does what it claims. I supposed I may buy it again to use in between real whitening treatments as a way to keep my teeth bright, but I dont think it will MAKE your teeth white on its own. A good product, and one I will buy again, but I doubt it will replace my standard one...
