  547. So I've been a &#34;Crest Kid&#34; my whole life but had never really strayed beyond just their typical toothpastes as I've always been happy with them - mostly the whitening and baking soda & peroxide. However, Crest presented me with the opportunity to try Crest Pro-Health HD I was excited to add something new to my routine.<br /><br />Crest Pro-Health HD is a two part system. First you brush for a minute with the purifying cleanser and, without rinsing, follow that with the second step which is the perfecting gel. Wow! I was really impressed and could tell a big difference the first time I used it! The purifying cleanser has kind of a foamy feel in your mouth. I can't really describe the taste; it's not at all minty but is sort of fresh. After a few seconds, it starts to feel almost like it's literally scrubbing your teeth. The feeling is a little gritty though there is no actual grit. It's kind of strange, but nice. Once you're done with that you'll use the perfecting gel which clearly is peroxide based as you can feel it bubbling in your mouth. There were many places on my gums (I'm embarrassed to say) where it bubbled up white as peroxide does on an infected wound. Yuck but I knew it was doing what it needed to do!<br /><br />The results were fantastic! My teeth were incredibly shiny - like beauty queen with Vaseline on her teeth shiny! After continued use, I could definitely tell a difference in the whiteness of my teeth. I didn't see the 6X whiter results Crest claims you may see, but my teeth were pretty white to start with; I did see a noticeable change so I was pleased.<br /><br />There were a couple of things I was not crazy about which were pretty minor. The first is that there is no minty taste which I am used to with toothpaste so it was a bit strange not having minty breath but my breath and mouth was definitely fresh; just not minty. Secondly, and this one is kind of random, as mentioned, you follow the first step immediately with the second step with no rinsing in between. The first step came in a tube with a flip off cap. The second step, however, came in a tube with a screw off lid. So, I'm standing there with toothpaste foaming all over my mouth and hands and toothbrush trying to screw off the second cap. I know it sounds stupid, but it really was kind of an inconvenience. I'm sure there is some reason, but it would be nice if the second step came with a flip top lid too.<br /><br />All in all, I am extremely happy with this product and will likely continue to use it. I don't have a check up for a few months, still but I'm looking forward to hearing if my dentist can tell a difference.the second step with no rinsing in between. The first step came in a tube with a flip off cap. The second step, however, came in a tube with a screw off lid. I'm sure there is some reason, but it would be nice if the second step came with a flip top lid too.<br /><br />All in all, I am extremely happy with this product and will likely continue to use it.   560. I was able to try a free sample of Crest Pro Health HD toothpaste and I really liked the results I saw. I started noticing a difference in the brightness of my teeth within a couple days and it only got better over the following weeks. Unlike most toothpastes it requires a little effort to use. There are two bottles and you brush with step 1 (the cleaner) for a minute, spit out the toothpaste (don’t rinse!), then brush with step 2 (the whitener) for 1 minute. I have a Sonicare toothbrush that beeps every 30 seconds so it was easy for me to know when I need to switch from top to bottom on my mouth or switch toothpastes. If I were to use a manual toothbrush I could see this toothpaste being a pain. The only real complaint I have about this toothpaste is the fact that you have to stop midbrush to switch toothpastes. If you can get over that, then this is probably the best toothpaste I’ve used. I’ve tried some whitening toothpastes that are really bitter but this one tastes really good! It has a good texture too. After step 1 your teeth are left feeling a little gritty, but step 2 seems to polish the grittiness away. I would definitely recommend this toothpaste.

  576. I was given crest pro-Health HD to try out. This product is great! I love it! Yes, it is a 2 step process, each step only lasting one min, for a total of 2 minutes, which is the recommended amount of time to brush anyways. The first step is a purifying cleanser aka anti cavity fluoride toothpaste, that after you brush for one min, you spit but do NOT rinse. This leaves your teeth gritty and mouth kind of dry- this feeling is similar to when the dentist polishes your teeth and your teeth feel gritty or sandy. Step 2 is a perfecting gel which you brush your teeth with it for 1 min and then you rinse. The perfecting gel is meant to whiten and polish your teeth. Both of these &#34;steps&#34; or pastes out together leave your mouth feeling sooo clean, as if you just got your teeth polished by the dentist. The fresh minty breath and clean feeling lasts almost all day and I noticed my teeth already looked whiter, with just one application! I plan on using crest pro-health for now on! Bye bye old regular toothpaste, hello crest pro-health HD and hello to a healthier, cleaner, whiter smile! Do yourself and your teeth a favor, give crest Pro-health HD a try, you and your teeth will not be disappointed!
  577. First impressions: Wow, did I just get my teeth professionally cleaned?? I started using it with my Oral-B power brush (after my dentist recommended it) and it just keeps getting better!<br /><br />After just a few days I noticed my teeth were noticeably whiter already. I use my electric toothbrush to help me time the application of each paste (it beeps every 30 seconds) and find both pastes pleasant enough. After I finish using the second paste, my teeth are noticeably whiter--like I'd just used strips for 30 minutes. Only it took just 2 minutes!<br /><br />If I have any complaint about this toothpaste, it's that the second gel doesn't leave a minty fresh taste in my mouth.   590. Please note, I was sent this product for free by Bzzz Agent to try it and review it. The opinions are my own.<br /><br />I am fairly critical when it comes to new products. I expect results and a positive user experience. I am rarely surprised by products. That said, this is a little bit of magic in two tubes. Unwrapping the box, my initial thought was this may be a bit too time intensive for me. I also doubted I'd see results in a week - nothing in my experience works that quickly. I was wrong on both counts. The use is quite simple - you squeeze a bit of tube number one on your toothbrush and brush for one minute - spit it out but don't rinse. Then you use a bit of the second tube, brush for another minute, spit then rinse and you will really have dental hygienist clean teeth. It adds, perhaps 20 seconds to your dental routine. I noticed a difference after the first use. And it's continued to improve. I tend to get an accumulation of plaque behind my lower teeth and on one where it's a bit crooked. The single tooth seems plaque free. The area behind my bottom teeth is vastly improved. And I saw this once month overdue for my cleaning! The plaque removing tube one is fantastic and really works well but its the HD polish tube number 2 that makes this product a game changer. Again, after one use my teeth were brighter and cleaner. After a full week, I cannot believe the difference. I don't feel a need to use whitening strips or any other brightening product on my teeth. As for the actual use - the taste is great, doesn't linger like some tooth products do. Doesn't feel overly harsh or burny on my tongue or lips. Leaves nice fresh breath after. And a little goes a long, long way. Overall, this product is amazing. I'm glad I have it and plan on rebuying as soon as I can.

  592. I've tried so many tooth whiteners before. They all do an okay job at tackling my surface stains, but I've never gotten results as white as those pictured on the packages before. In only seven days, my teeth look as white as they used to look before I started drinking soda, tea and coffee! My smile truly is like new. There are a few cons to the product which users should be aware of: 1) it's a two-step process. It doesn't add that much time to your brushing routine, but it is something you have to get used to. 2) I found that my gums were sensitive to the ingredients and I started developing some irritation when I was using the paste to brush my teeth every time that I did (which is usually three times a day.) When I limited my use to only once and made sure to rinse thoroughly after, the irritation went away. Just think - only using this product one time a day for seven days and my mouth looks AMAZING! I am very glad that Crest chose me as a recipient of a sample product and would highly recommend it.

The first is a purifying cleanser that “helps strip away plaque.” To me, stripping seems damaging, but let’s give it a shot anyway as it indicates this can provide 6X whiter teeth in one week (vs. ordinary toothpaste). After using step one, I did not feel like I had that minty fresh breath; however, it did leave my teeth feeling clean, almost as clean as after a professional cleaning. You do not rinse, but then use step two, the perfecting gel. This step tasted similar to teeth whitening strips, in my opinion. I would prefer to have been left with invigorating, minty fresh breath.<br />Overall, I was a little nervous to try this since I do have sensitive teeth, but found that my teeth were whiter by about two shades in a little over a week and I did not have high sensitivity. I would most likely continue to use the product alternating between this and a sensitive tooth paste. I feel like it did do a good job whitening and cleaning my teeth, but feel the after taste was not what I was used to or wanted.

Overall it's a good product in my opinion. My mouth feels clean, and my teeth do appear to be a bit whiter after a few weeks use. I don't think I could stand to use it for every brushing as the two steps are a bit time consuming but I will likely purchase another round in the future.

Brush with each toothpaste for one minute and then rinse. The first toothpaste is the cleaner, which really seems to do a good job with the cleaning. Brush for a minute and then after that do not rinse and use the whitener. Brush for a minute and then rinse. Two things I noticed right away with this method. One, it gets me to brush my teeth for the 2 minutes, like the dentist recommends and secondly, my teeth did not feel the whitening aspect which normally hurts my teeth. It feels like with this system the first toothpaste helps coat your teeth to prevent the sensitivity. Great method Crest! It takes a bit longer to brush than with a regular toothpaste but I found I was willing to perform the two steps. It did take some getting used to but it was really only a couple of days until I settled into the two-step routine. One thing to keep in mind is that the second step gel is a bit watery so I found that I usually needed to keep the brush upright as I applied the gel because it had the tendency to run off the side of the brush. The gel also comes out fast so you don't need to squeeze it very hard. Overall I liked it and didn’t mind the two steps. The reason I removed a star, though, is because my mouth didn’t feel very fresh and minty as I would like after brushing.

Because of this thin material, there's a lot more toothpaste in the tube than what you would normally come to expect from a regular tube of toothpaste. I read the instructions and it is a two step process - you brush for one minute with tube 1, spit, brush for another minute with tube 1, rinse and spit, and you're done! I took a before picture and decided I would take another picture after six days. My teeth are average in color. I typically tend to drink one coffee or one soda a day. I do get a little plaque build up on the back of my three bottom teeth. The package says that you can expect whiter teeh in six days. I did just as instructed and once I was finished, my teeth/mouth had that 'just left the dentist' clean feeling. I loved it! After six days of using both tubes twice a day, I can tell you my teeth were whiter and better yet, I don't have any plaque build up behind my bottom teeth at all! That was a big surprise for me. The only con I have is that the two step process isn't as convenient, even if you are only brushing your teeth for a total of two minutes. After my fourth or fifth brush, my gums were a little sore. I realized that I was brushing my teeth too hard. I think I've brushed my teeth too hard in the past in order to get rid of plaque build up, but realized that I didn't have to put in that much work with Crest Prohealth HD. Flossing my teeth to get rid of the plaque build up wasn't an option - there was no plaque build up at all.   668. I was given this product free to try by Crest through the website BzzAgent and at first I was skeptical of using 2 different tubes to brush my teeth everyday. I have a young baby and a super busy life, adding an extra step to my daily routine is not always easy. However, when I saw that you only brush with each step for 1 minute I realized that it takes maybe 5 extra seconds over traditional toothpaste.<br /><br />This is a 2 step process, the first tube they say is what brushes away plaque and cleans your teeth. This step has the taste and consistency of your average toothpaste. I was caught a little off guard though that the warnings on this tube explain that some of the ingredients could cause white spots that your dentist could remove. However, after using for 2 weeks, I've seen no extra staining. I imagine this is rare and the warning also says you can help avoid them by thoroughly brushing.<br /><br />The 2nd step is a clear gel with a slight bitter taste although it's barely noticeable. The consistency reminds me of hair gel. This is the &#34;polishing and whitening&#34; step. This gel produces no foam, it's just gently spread over your teeth. I brushed in small circles during this step.<br /><br />My initial thought when I was finished the first time was &#34;wow, my teeth feel crazy smooth!&#34;- a feeling that I continue to notice after every time I use this 2 step process. By the 2nd time I used it I could definitely tell a difference in whitening. By the end of the first week, I saw a very marked difference. I am a HEAVY coffee drinker and as a result I usually see light staining at the corners of my bottom front teeth and slight brown lines on the backside of my bottom front teeth. After that first week I was checking the staining and there are NO brown lines on the backside of my teeth and the slight yellow at the corners of the bottom &#34;canine&#34; teeth is barely visible. I have a dentist appointment in 2 weeks and I think they will be pleased!<br /><br /> The only down fall to this (besides the possibility of leaving white spots) would be that I experienced increased sensitivity in my teeth after the 2nd or 3rd time using it. After the initial week of using only this, I started switching it up and using it every other day. I have sensitive teeth usually anyway so it may just be a side effect of people who already have that condition as my husband who does not experience sensitivity said he felt no difference. Although he had a bit of a hard time adjusting to not &#34;rinsing&#34; after the first step before starting the 2nd step. I'm not sure what happens if you do rinse between steps but the directions instruct you to just spit after 1 minute of brushing with the 1st step and then you add the 2nd step (the clear gel) and continue brushing for 1 more minute. Since you are supposed to brush for 2 minutes with regular toothpaste, this was not cumbersome, adding unnecessarily to your brushing time. Like I mentioned earlier, MAYBE an extra 5 seconds to add step 2 to your toothbrush.<br /><br />Overall this is a product I'm probably going to incorporate into my regular regimen, probably using it at night every other day. I would definitely recommend this product to a friend./><br /> The only down fall to this (besides the possibility of leaving white spots) would be that I experienced increased sensitivity in my teeth after the 2nd or 3rd time using it. After the initial week of using only this, I started switching it up and using it every other day. I have sensitive teeth usually anyway so it may just be a side effect of people who already have that condition as my husband who does not experience sensitivity said he felt no difference. Although he had a bit of a hard time adjusting to not &#34;rinsing&#34; after the first step before starting the 2nd step. I'm not sure what happens if you do rinse between steps but the directions instruct you to just spit after 1 minute of brushing with the 1st step and then you add the 2nd step (the clear gel) and continue brushing for 1 more minute. Since you are supposed to brush for 2 minutes with regular toothpaste, this was not cumbersome, adding unnecessarily to your brushing time. Like I mentioned earlier, MAYBE an extra 5 seconds to add step 2 to your toothbrush.<br /><br />Overall this is a product I'm probably going to incorporate into my regular regimen, probably using it at night every other day. I would definitely recommend this product to a friend.

  670. I received sample of Crest Pro Health HD for free to try through BzzAgent. I decided to use Crest Pro Health HD for a few days before I wrote this review. The product boasts 6x healthier and whiter teeth in a week.<br />First, let me comment on the packaging. &#34;Regular&#34; toothpaste comes in a rectangular box with a smaller footprint than this toothpaste comes in. Due in part to the two packages of toothpaste instead of the normal one. Also, the packaging makes the product stand out, with a masculine-looking blue packaging scheme. However, I did find the box a bit hard to open, even with the pull tab on one of the corners. I feel that perhaps the packaging could be easier to open and maybe a bit smaller.<br />Second, taste and effect. Since this is a two step process, brushing will take twice as long as before, but I didn't really notice this too much. Step 1, the cleanser, has a nice wintergreen-type flavor.I like the Crest alcohol free mouthwash. I was highly concerned when I saw all the negative reviews that there must be something wrong with me. But it tastes great and doesn't burn. I like this because I don't really like the peppermint-type flavor of a lot of other toothpastes. It also felt a bit grainier than other toothpastes, but maybe this is because I couldn't rinse after I brushed. Step 2 is a polisher, a gel paste. This gel had a very medicinal flavor which I didn't find pleasant, but it wasn't off-putting too much. It also had that mouthburn type of reaction that you might get with a strong mouthwash. After finishing with Step 2, you can rinse. I just rinse with some water and my mouth does indeed feel fresher and cleaner after I brush with this product. I haven't noticed, however, if my teeth are whiter, so I might give the product more time to see if I can notice a difference.

I haven't experienced any sensitivity at all after using the product 2 times a day for 2 weeks, yet my teeth are noticably whiter and brighter. Compated to whitening strips I also find this system much quicker and easier and just as effective.<br />What I love most about the 2 part system is that my mouth feels so much fresher for a lot longer than I've ever experienced with other toothpastes. For this system, You brush with the step 1(plaque remover) for 1 minute and then you spit (don't rinse!) and follow up with step 2, the whitener & polisher. Once I do this routine & floss at night I wake up the next morning feeling like I just brushed my teeth! My husband was so impressed he took my kit & now I have to stock up again! Amazon has great pricing on this kit if you're shopping around.<br />I was lucky enough to try this free as a Bzzagent, and I will definitely continue to purchase it in the future! You immediately follow up with tube 2, the whitening gel. You brush for another minute and then rinse clean. Simple as that!<br /><br />After a few days, I was already noticing results.   679. I've been using Crest Pro Health HD twice per day for about the last four weeks (I received it for free as part of a BzzAgent word-of-mouth marketing program). From first brush, my teeth felt clean and my mouth refreshed. And about a week in, I had a regular cleaning with my dentist who said my teeth looked great - though with only a week of use, I'm not sure how much of my passing marks could be attributed to the toothpaste (though I had been using Crest Complete Multi-Benefit previously, of which I am a big fan). Over time, I haven't noticed any further improvements. My mouth doesn't feel necessarily healthier (though, admittedly, that would be tough for me to gauge by feel) and my teeth don't look particularly whiter. Additionally, I don't like the taste of the whitening gel (almost saccharin) and a two-step process is really annoying with an electric toothbrush. Previously, I'd brush in four quadrants for 30 seconds each. Now, I brush in each quadrant for 15 seconds, twice. Plus, I have to stop in the middle to add the gel. Brushing my teeth is already a chore - why make it more difficult? TLDR; makes my mouth feel good, but the inconvenience of using with an electric toothbrush means I won't continue to use it once it's done.

No matter how much I brush my teeth, I still wind up with plaque and calcium build-up on and around my teeth. Which in turn leads to a lecture and some yelling, and that just makes me dislike going there. As I said above, I've used Pro-Health for some time, but always the regular products of the line. The only downside is this toothpaste does seem to make my gums bleed more than regular toothpaste, but I've also read that that means it's working on healing them and it's something one should expect.<br /><br />I did have to give this four stars though because while it definitely is giving my mouth a cleaner and healthier feeling, the whitening isn't doing what I expected it to. While my teeth aren't as dull, they just don't seem any whiter. But in the long run, a healthier mouth is more important to me than whiter teeth, and so it gets four stars.

  719.   727. As a BzzAgent, I received a free sample of Crest Pro Health HD. The teeth cleansing system is an interesting experience. It is a two-step process.   732. What I like about Crest Pro Health® HD™ is that it is an easy two step system that only takes two minutes (vs. some of the whitening strips that you have to leave on for 30 minutes). You can use the tooth whitening system the way that you use your toothpaste or gel - and I like that it does not foam like crazy (I have an electric toothbrush and some toothpastes go all over the place). First you apply the purifying cleanser for one minute - do NOT rinse with water afterwards! I like the nice minty taste of it. Afterwards you apply the perfecting gel for one minute. I wished the gel was a little bit more minty - but otherwise it is good and does not irritate my gums. I cannot see that my teeth are six times whiter as promised after one week (but I use a good electronic toothbrush that usually removes stains and plaque pretty well) - but my mouth feels clean and healthy without the hassle of whitening strips and normal time involvement as I always brush for two minutes. The cost is lower compared with whitening strips and the system should last approximately two months. I like that you get a full money back guarantee if you do not like it. I am trying it free thanks to Crest.

  736. I received a free full-sized Crest Pro-Health HD to try and review as part of a promotion.<br /><br />I have been consistently using Pro-Health HD for over a month, and I'm satisfied with the result and am impressed with the amount of toothpaste and whitening gel that comes in the two tubes. I break down my review into the two main product benefits: cleaning and whitening.<br /><br />Cleaning: 5/5 stars. The toothpaste (Step 1) cleans my teeth the best of any toothpaste I've used. My teeth feel clean and polished after the instructed one minute brushing, almost like leaving the dentist's office after a professional brushing/polishing. I'm left with a very fresh, minty mouth afterwards.<br /><br />Whitening: 3/5 stars. As a casual coffee and tea drinker (one or two cups a day combined), my teeth tend to get minor stains, especially if I forget to drink water right after tea or coffee. The combination of the deep cleaning toothpaste and the whitening gel works to remove those minor stains and I can have another cup without feeling too guilty about it.<br /><br />The whitening gel, however, works about the same as whitening strips. My teeth are slightly whiter, but not by much. Fortunately, the Crest Pro-Health HD kit is more affordable than the whitening strips or a professional whitening.<br /><br />Overall: 4/5 stars. In just two minutes, I have a much cleaner mouth and teeth that feel polished, and the added bonus of a hint of whitening. Having to use two different products in one brushing isn't so bad once you get used to the routine. Also, like with most whitening strips, the first few times I used it my teeth and gums were a little sensitive for a few days, but everything feels fine now.<br /><br />Finally, the sucralose ingredient in the whitening gel leaves an after-taste that's too sweet, but can be mitigated with a good water rinse.<br /><br />For the price you pay, you get decent value out of the kit since you would end up paying much more money by buying a separate toothpaste and whitening strips. It's certainly worth a try. Maybe it'll keep you smiling.separate toothpaste and whitening strips. It's certainly worth a try. Maybe it'll keep you smiling.

I am happy to report that over my time using this product I have not experienced any increased tooth sensitivity.<br />The only negative I have noticed for this toothpaste is that it feels pretty dry, but after rinsing with water and mouthwash it goes away.<br />I started using the sample of Crest Pro Health HD that I received from Crest soon after I had my teeth whitened so I didn't not notice my teeth getting any whiter. I have noticed that over the almost two months I have used this toothpaste my teeth have not gotten any darker which had always been a problem.<br />Some people will be turned off by this being a two part toothpaste. I got used to it pretty quickly, using an electric toothpaste with built in timer made keeping track of the time easy.<br />I ended up really liking this toothpaste, my main concern of tooth sensitivity was not an issue and my mouth has felt clean and fresh.
  770. I think Crest Pro Health HD is a great two part whitening toothpaste system. I'm 73, I drink coffee everyday and I smoked for over fifty-five years. I quit smoking over two years ago and my teeth will never be brilliantly white. I was pleasantly surprised that the Crest Pro Health HD whitening system that BzzAgent sent me did make a difference in the brightness and whiteness of my teeth. It was not as complicated to use as some whitening systems I have tried in the past. It was not as messy and did not require whitening trays or extensive amounts of time.<br /><br />Step 1 is the fluoride toothpaste that helps guard against cavities and gingivitis. This is the part that is spit out and not rinsed out with water. It helps to remove the plaque and stains on the teeth. There was one warning on the label that I found ironic. The warning on the label was &#34;products containing stannous fluoride may produce staining of the teeth.&#34; That did not happen with me and I noticed that the two part system actually helped to remove stains from my teeth. Since everyone's body chemistry is different, that warning may have to be there in case it applies to a certain segment of the population. This part literally only takes one minute and it tastes minty so it's pleasant.<br /><br />Step 2 is the Perfecting Gel, the whitening gel that contains hydrogen peroxide. This part also takes literally one minute but it can be rinsed after that minute. Part 2 is the polishing gel that really helps to whiten the teeth. It also has a pleasant minty taste.<br /><br />Overall I really liked the Crest Pro Health HD two step whitening system. It really does not take very long to do each day, literally four minutes per day, two minutes each time. Under five minutes per day to make teeth whiter and brighter seems reasonable to me. I use Crest Pro Health products on a regular basis and I think this two part system is my favorite new Crest whitening system.
  771. This is a great toothpaste and brightener. It has done an incredibly job whitening my teeth but as a toothpaste alone it might be worth a try. After you brush your teeth feel clean and there is little to no after taste or dry mouth common with other options.<br />The 2nd tube is a polish and brightener. It does a great job but will also show if you don't brush to your gums. After using it for a week I realized I needed to get closer to my bottom gums but the difference in color.   775. I got to try Crest Pro Health HD for free as part of BzzAgent and to make sure I really knew if it worked, I had to give it a while to try. After all, whitening your teeth can take time, and I wanted to make sure I could see any difference.<br /><br />Well, I *think* my teeth are whiter after trying it, but it's hard to say really. I will say that this system is pretty easy to use. You brush your teeth for one minute using the toothpaste, which is a little bit &#34;gritty&#34; like so that it kind of polishes your teeth and gets them ready for the whitening gel. It's not rough on teeth or anything, just a little more gritty than your regular toothpaste might be, again just in a way that preps your teeth for the whitening gel.<br /><br />The whitening gel is also easy to use. Once you brush your teeth with the toothpaste (step 1), you spit but don't rinse and then apply the whitening gel (step 2) to your toothbrush and brush for another minute. Luckily I use a Sonicare that counts off minutes so I was easily able to switch between the two; however, I will say it was a little bit annoying to have to do two steps and switch back and forth. It's not a super-huge deal or anything, but just an additional step when you compare this to something like a whitening strip.<br /><br />The whitening gel is fairly thick and doesn't drip down much. You use it much like a toothpaste although of course it doesn't foam. It can irritate gums and your mouth slightly if you're sensitive--I had some whiteness on my gums that went away quickly and the packaging does warn you about this. My teeth never hurt at all when using this though. After using this for several weeks, I feel like my teeth were--maybe not *whiter* but a consistent level of whiteness that matched where I started. I drink a lot of tea and so to keep the staining down, that helped. I have used Crest's whitestrips before and I feel like those actually are easier to use and keep teeth more visibly white, so I'm not convinced that this is a better system, but for someone who wants the convenience of just brushing teeth rather than using strips, this could work really well.that this is a better system, but for someone who wants the convenience of just brushing teeth rather than using strips, this could work really well.
  776. Loving BzzAgent right now. I was lucky to receive Crest Pro-Health HD to try out for free. I will be honest though, at first I thought that it would turn out to be just like all of the other &#34;whitening&#34; toothpastes found on the toothpaste aisle, I was proved wrong.   777. I tried out the Crest Pro-Health HD toothpaste and whitening system for free, with a box that Crest sent me for free. The results I received were similar to those I’ve gotten using other at-home whitening products: 1-2 shades whiter on a teeth shade scale. This seems to be as good as I can expect, unless I get it professionally done at the dentist, which I don’t think I’ll be doing anytime soon. I didn’t quite get the ‘6X’ results Crest advertised, but my teeth are definitely noticeably whiter than they were before. Hopefully they’re healthier too (as Crest also says), but I don’t know how to measure that. I do know that I like the two step system. It’s easy to remember (once you resist your initial instinct to rinse after Step 1) and was easy to integrate into my already two-times-a-day brushing . So all I needed to do was add two more minutes to my current routine (one minute per morning & evening brushing). Something that simple to do that provides similar results to other products out there that involve much more time and/or effort is good in my book. The only thing is the price – I wish it was at least $10 cheaper. Hopefully Crest will put it on sale from time to time. Or sell it in bulk at Costco, etc.

  790. I got Crest Pro Health HD free through a marketing website. I hate to say, I was not a fan of the step 1 purifying cleanser, it also leaves a strange residue on your teeth and gums that feels quite chalky and dry. After I used it for a few times I got used to it, and now barely recognize that residue, but it comes as a shock when you are new to the product. The step 2 toothpaste is a gel that goes on smoothly and leaves your teeth feeling really good! It is much smoother than other products I have used, and seems to last longer as well despite normal daily wear and tear. A few days into trying this, I ran into another problem as well. My gums became very irritated from the constant brushing, they were sensitive and would bleed. I tried to keep it up, but it was rough to eat with them being so inflamed so I use the product once a day instead of twice and now have found my happy medium. I also did notice my teeth are whiter, this is not drastic and though my husband noticed, it might just have been because he was looking for it =)<br /><br />So to summarize, the step 1 toothpaste does not taste or feel the best, and if you overuse the product you will get sore and irritated gums, but it is still worth it if you want smooth and white teeth!

Not so perfect, in my opinion. I am used to having a fresh, minty mouth after brushing my teeth, but Step 2 seems to eliminate the initial burst of freshness that Step 1 leaves. It really is too bad because while having to go through a 2-step process isn't the most convenient, I can deal with the extra step. What I can't deal with is anything leaving a bad taste in my mouth.   836. Before providing a review of Crest Pro Health HD teeth whitening system, I should start by saying that I have been a Crest Pro Health user for quite some time now. And, over the years, I have used two different Crest teeth whitening strips. And, while I have always used Crest and been satisfied with their products, I was not a big fan of the whitening strips. I personally don't find them to be convenient.<br /><br />After receiving a sample of this product as part of a BZZAgent promotion, I reviewed the contents of the package as well as the instructions. Why two tubes? There are two steps to this whitening process. Step One is a cleaning process with stannous fluoride for gingivitis reduction. The substance looks a lot like a normal toothpaste. It is blue in color and is a bit thicker than my standard toothpaste. Step Two is the whitener, which is a clear substance.<br /><br />The instructions indicate you should use Step One for one minute, then rinse your brush BUT not your mouth, then use Step Two for one minute. This surprised me a bit because I brush longer than two minutes. So, I found myself brushing with Step One a bit longer than directed, maybe an extra minute. Because the taste of Step One was pleasant, I did not feel rushed or anxious to get to Step Two.<br /><br />When applying Step Two to the brush, I learned to use caution when squeezing from the tube because the substance comes out from the tube much quicker and easier than with Step One. I found Step Two to taste very much like the same substance used with the Crest whitening strips. Because I had cleaned my teeth already, I used a light brushing motion with Step Two, gently applying the whitener to my teeth. After one minute of brushing, I would rinse my mouth and brush.<br /><br />Crest claims to give you a 6x healthier mouth and 6x brighter smile after using the system for one week. I did use the product for a solid week and probably all but one day. I don't think I had a 6x whiter smile, but there is no question my smile was/is a few shades whiter. I absolutely feel like my mouth is healthier with this toothpaste. I'm not sure if I'd feel that way if I only used the one minute of brushing as directed by Crest, however.ere is no question my smile was/is a few shades whiter. I absolutely feel like my mouth is healthier with this toothpaste. I'm not sure if I'd feel that way if I only used the one minute of brushing as directed by Crest, however.

  843. I'd seen Crest Pro Health HD in the store and even had it in my hand before. The mucosa in my mouth will peel off in layers. Colgate Total is the brand I was sticking with because the reaction wasn't as bad, just slight shedding. The original Crest Pro Health whitening toothpaste was the worst for my mouth. It would peel off in thick layers and leave my mouth bloody and sore. This is why I was scared to try this product. I assumed it would be the same ingredients, but more concentrated, which would mean a more severe reaction. This is a warning that Crest has listed, so I know many consumers experience this reaction. I was still hesitant to try the product when I received it in the mail. There are 2 steps for the process. The 1st step is to clean your teeth for a minute with the stannous flouride toothpaste. It does a wonderful job at removing tarter and plaque. Plus, you are left with a fresh mouth all day and no more bad morning breath. The 2nd step is to whiten your teeth with the hydrogen peroxide gel. All you do is brush for 1 minute. Spit and do not rinse your mouth out at any point during the 2 minute cleaning. I keep the 2 steps with my toothbrush, so I don't forget to use both products. It's only takes a dab of each for a fresh and white smile. After a month of use, my mouth feels clean all the time and my teeth are whiter. I've never had results like this with only whitening toothpaste. I haven't had much of a sensitivity to it either. My mouth has only shed 1 the surface layer once, which is the best I've experience since the whitening craze took over the toothpaste aisle. I will definitely be purchasing this product as my everyday toothpaste from now on. It's worth every penny and is lasting a long time.It's worth every penny and is lasting a long time.

  850. I got to try the Crest Pro Health HD kit for free from BzzAgent. Although, I was a bit skeptical about having to do 2 steps instead of just one, the results are worth it! My teeth definitely felt squeaky clean, the way they do when you leave the dental office after a cleaning.<br /><br />Step 1 is the paste that contains fluoride and looks just like standard toothpaste. Brush with step 1 for 60 seconds, then spit. DO NOT rinse.<br /><br />Step 2 is the polish which is a clear gel. Then add the gel to your toothbrush and brush for another 60 seconds. Then rinse.<br /><br />Voila! Clean and polished teeth!<br /><br />Important instructions: You MUST use both of them and follow the instructions correctly. I learned this the hard way. I thought I could get away with just using the paste instead of the gel. DO NOT do this. You'll be left with a really weird taste and feeling in your mouth. Take the extra 60 seconds to do step 2. Its worth it!
  851. I've tried this product for free courtesy of Crest and BzzAgent. This two-step toothpaste definitely whitens your teeth effectively, but unfortunately, the whitening peroxide gel is too strong for my gums; when used two times a day a couple days in a row, it causes little annoying sores. The cleanser (first step) is also not my favorite, I found the feel of it in my mouth and the aftertaste to be very strange, almost dry and chalky. However, compared to other brands of whitening toothpaste, the Crest Pro-Health HD made the biggest difference in the whiteness of my teeth - so if your teeth and gums aren't very sensitive, I'd say give it a go! You also only need a little bit, so the set is going to last you a long time.
  852. Full disclosure, I tried this product thanks to Crest. I love the product itself! It takes just two minutes; one with the pleasantly gritty purifying cleanser, and then after spitting but not rinsing, one minute with the perfecting gel added to the toothbrush. The cleanser really feels like it's getting work done and the gel smooths everything over; both are refreshingly minty. Best of all, there's no sensitivity like I experience with other extreme whitening products - no white spots on gums, no tooth pain, etc. I really love the product, but I take one star off for two reason: the price is a bit steep for an everyday toothpaste, so I wouldn't probably use it on a regular basis, just &#34;as needed&#34; to give me a boost of whitening. And two, it's a bit inconvenient to have two containers. I wish the product was in one container with two separate openings.

This is a pain for me because Step one has an easy flip top and Step two has a twist top. WHY??? To make my life more difficult... NOT EASIER CREST!! Make them both flip tops, guys!!<br />Next, price. Compared to other brands it's right on target. Ability to whiten. I haven't noticed a difference. I didn't see a noticeable difference on the first use or on the mid-point either. I use a whitening toothpaste without an extra whitening gel. So, I guess the whitening gel is in question. It doesn't have to stay on any longer than the minute you use to brush it on so I am questioning it's effectiveness. I am seeing my dentist in 2 weeks so we will see what he has to say. I don't have problem teeth to begin with but I don't have beaming whites either. If he notices a difference, that will be the test!<br />I do love the taste.   854. I normally don't use whitening products, since I have sensitive teeth, and the whitening agents usually cause increased sensitivity, but I thought I'd give Crest Pro Health® HD™ a try, to see what happened.<br /><br />I used Crest Pro Health® HD™ for one full week, twice a day, following the instructions. My teeth are naturally not-that-white, and I don't help things by drinking lots of tea, so I was hoping to see some good results after the week was up. I took a before picture, and started the trial. There are two different products in the kit - a cleaning toothpaste, which tasted and felt like a standard toothpaste, and a whitening gel, which, frankly, I did not like. It had an odd flavor - or maybe it was just a lack of mintiness that didn't cover up the other flavors of the gel. It wasn't an unpleasant flavor - more of just an odd _lack_ of flavor. But, I muddled through for the week.<br /><br />After the week was up, I took an &#34;after&#34; picture, and I could really notice a difference in my teeth's whiteness. It wasn't a _huge_ difference, but there was definitely some whitening going on. My wife could also see the difference between the pictures. So, yes, the Crest Pro Health® HD™ _did_ whiten my teeth as promised - not dramatically, but I think with extended usage, the whitening would become more pronounced.<br /><br />However, I also did notice the increased tooth sensitivity from using this product. So, even though it _did_ do a pretty good job of whitening, with a minimum of hassle, I'll probably not be using it as my everyday toothpaste. I'll probably put it in the rotation every few months - just to re-whiten a bit, but I need a sensitive-teeth toothpaste on a day-to-day basis.<br /><br />All in all, Crest Pro Health® HD™ delivered on it's whitening promise, and if they ever do come out with a version for sensitive teeth, I'll definitely give that one a try.<br /><br />(I did receive a free sample of this product from Crest via BzzAgent)

  873. I got this for free through BzzAgent and was rather skeptical because every specialty whitening product I've tried has made my teeth start to hurt after a couple of days, forcing me to quit whatever whitening regimen I'm on. So if you're a better dental patient than I am, you're probably already brushing for two minutes. Long story short, you're not adding any more time to your morning rituals.<br /><br />Now you can rinse!   891. Thanks to BzzAgent and Crest for the promo trial of this great product!<br />I'm always skeptical of products that seem so simple but make big claims. Two minutes twice a day to make my teeth noticeably whiter? No way, I thought. But I decided to give it a try.<br /><br />The first thing you should know about this product is that it does NOT taste like your regular toothpaste. Step 1 looks like that familiar blue gel, and it is kinda minty, but Step 2 is a clear, goopy gel that tastes like peroxide. You aren't going to finish brushing with this product and feel kissably fresh. Plus, you may see tiny white splotches on your gums or tongue (do not be alarmed--this is totally normal.)<br /><br />Let me tell you, though, what you give up in that minty-fresh feeling, you get back in spades. First, my mouth and teeth have never felt cleaner than they do after brushing with this product. I also didn't experience any of the sensitivity that I have with other whitening products. What I did get, though, were noticeably whiter teeth. I started to notice a difference after just 4 days, and after a week my teeth were definitely a new pearlier white. Even my roommate noticed!<br /><br />I'm very impressed, and I will be purchasing the Crest ProHealth HD 2-Step System again!
  892. I was given the opportunity to try Crest Pro Health HD for free - courtesy of Crest. It is a 2 step process - you use Step 1 toothpaste for one minute as this is your plaque removal process. You DO NOT rinse after Step 1 - you then use Step 2 for one minute as this is the polishing step (then you rinse). Says it will get your teeth up to 6 x's whiter - I only noticed maybe 1-2 x's whiter - if that. I used this system for exactly one month. I brushed twice a day. My likes? Totally fresh breath, very clean when I run my tongue over my teeth, some improvement on whitening, simple to use. My problems with this system? Gets kind of annoying to have to switch using different tubes of toothpaste, no major whitening noted, Step 2 doesn't taste great and it may irritate your gum line w/ the peroxide, I ran out of Step 1 in exactly 30 days and still had plenty of Step 2 so I couldn't do the whole system anymore, not nearly the whitening I was hoping for, I like to brush my tongue and gum line so I'd have to do this separately or with another toothpaste (not with this whitening product), and it's not sold at all stores. It does a great job of giving you a fresh from the dentist clean feeling, but the whitening? So, So.

It seems to do the job because of the somewhat gritty-nature of the paste. The second tube or step two polishes my teeth and leaves them feeling smooth and squeaky clean!<br /><br />It's been about one month since I began using Crest Pro Health HD and I have about half of both tubes still left to use which means it seems to last a long time and is worth the reasonable price to pay.   904. I'm on the record as being skeptical when it comes to a lot of dental hygiene product's whitening claims. Step 1 is similar to your everyday toothpaste. It's minty and fresh, and generally decent, bordering on good. Step 2 is where the Pro Health HD really differentiates itself, though. The &#34;perfecting gel&#34; reminded me of the kind of fluoride treatment you could formerly only receive at the dentist. It leaves my teeth feeling shiny (if that makes any sense), and the fresh tasting gel is just abrasive enough to polish my teeth -- or at least make me feel like they are. Brushing takes a little longer, which probably isn't a bad thing, and after a few weeks, I'm actually beginning to see a slight improvement in tooth color. Whitening toothpaste has never made a noticeable impact for me, but this product did. In my book, that's enough!

  910. I was excited to receive the Crest Pro Health HD system as part of the BzzAgent campaign. It seemed like a unique product and I'm normally a fan of Crest products. As background, I am avid about flossing every day and brushing as well. However, I do not tend to purchase and/or use products specifically for whitening. I am not a smoker, although I do drink coffee a few times a week.<br /><br />The Crest Pro Health HD system uses a two step (and two separate tube) process. As is, that seemed quite involved and time consuming, as a mom of a toddler who does not tend to have extra time for non-basic grooming! However, I was willing to give this a try and wanted to give it a fair try. I attempted to use this product exclusively for several weeks before writing my review. The first step/tube has a slightly gritty texture and a light mint taste. It is not unpleasant, although my husband did not care for the texture. Personally, I tend to want a stronger mint flavor in my toothpaste. The directions state to brush with the first step for one minute and then spit out the toothpaste without rinsing with water before using the second step. The second step/tube is a very watery gel that I felt had a very unpleasant taste. (My husband stopped using the second step after his first time brushing with it because of its taste.) After the second step, the directions have you rinsing the product out of your mouth.<br /><br />I could not get used to the taste of the second tube although I used both tubes every time I used the product. After the first few days, I ended up only using the Crest system at night. I switched to my regular toothpaste in the mornings in order to have fresher breath. The aftertaste of the second product felt bitter and did not seem to help with morning breath for me. I also did not like the watery texture of the second product and weirdly had a hard time brushing with it for a full minute, as there wasn't much substance to brush with - no foam, dripped out of mouth easily, etc.<br /><br />Despite using the product only at night (once a day), I actually did feel as if the product made my teeth feel cleaner. The film that sometimes accumulates on the surface of my teeth did not seem to be there. The buildup that sometimes occurs at the gumline did not seem to be there. And, although I did not take a before and after photo (nor do I think that it would truly show because of home lighting, etc.), I felt as if my teeth were slightly whiter than when I started using this product.<br /><br />Last week, I had my 6 month teeth cleaning at my dentist. Although my dentist did not mention anything specifically about the condition of my teeth, I felt as if my appointment seemed a little quicker than it sometimes can be. (I also did not tell my dentist about my use of this product, as I was wondering if it would be noticeable.) Added to that, over the two months that I've been using the product, none of my friends or family members have noticed or commented on a difference in my teeth. Of course, most of my own observations are purely anecdotal.<br /><br />Overall, given the time that the product feels like it's taking - I know you're supposed to brush 2 minutes with regular toothpaste, but this feels longer having to use two products - and it's price, it is unlikely that I will re-purchase this product. If it were an all in one product, instead of two tubes, I would definitely reconsider given the perceived results. However, the real kicker for me is the taste of the product. I do not feel that it has helped with morning breath nor does it give me a fresh mint/clean taste after brushing. For the price, I would go with another product for my teeth.dripped out of mouth easily, etc.<br /><br />Despite using the product only at night (once a day), I actually did feel as if the product made my teeth feel cleaner. The film that sometimes accumulates on the surface of my teeth did not seem to be there. The buildup that sometimes occurs at the gumline did not seem to be there. And, although I did not take a before and after photo (nor do I think that it would truly show because of home lighting, etc.), I felt as if my teeth were slightly whiter than when I started using this product.<br /><br />Last week, I had my 6 month teeth cleaning at my dentist. Although my dentist did not mention anything specifically about the condition of my teeth, I felt as if my appointment seemed a little quicker than it sometimes can be. (I also did not tell my dentist about my use of this product, as I was wondering if it would be noticeable.) Added to that, over the two months that I've been using the product, none of my friends or family members have noticed or commented on a difference in my teeth. Of course, most of my own observations are purely anecdotal.<br /><br />Overall, given the time that the product feels like it's taking - I know you're supposed to brush 2 minutes with regular toothpaste, but this feels longer having to use two products - and it's price, it is unlikely that I will re-purchase this product. If it were an all in one product, instead of two tubes, I would definitely reconsider given the perceived results. However, the real kicker for me is the taste of the product. I do not feel that it has helped with morning breath nor does it give me a fresh mint/clean taste after brushing. For the price, I would go with another product for my teeth.

I had a dental appointment about half way through using this product and my hygenist comentted on how clean my teeth were looking.

  983. First of all, let me tell you that i received this product free to try from Crest. Now let's get down to the nuts and bolts of it. Brushing your teeth is a pretty mundane task. Not too much excitement or change. Paste...Brush...Rinse and you're done. When I saw that this was a two step process, I was intrigued. Never have I stopped midway to apply the second tube and continue brushing. With that being said, I have noticed many positives and very few negatives. My teeth felt great after I was done. It leaves you with that after the dentist feeling where you feel the clean teeth more than usual. I generally use a whitening toothpaste so I have not noticed any special whitening powers after a week of use. Overall, the taste is good, not quite as minty as some other flavors, but still good. I also could be imagining things, but I haven't woken up with terrible morning breath which I would assume could be attributed to the cleaning powers of step 1. The two main negatives that I have discovered is Step 1 leaves you with dry mouth. You are supposed to spit after step one but not rinse. I find my mouth to be extremely dry at this point and would love a drink, but have resisted to allow the paste to work as it is intended. This dry mouth feeling does go away after step 2 so it's not terrible. Also, the design of the tubes are a bit odd. Step 1 has a flip top which is simple to use. Step 2 however has an oval twist top which is a bit cumbersome since this is being done in the middle of the brushing. If Crest is trying to differentiate the two tubes so as to not get confused in the dark, it would make more sense to me to switch them and have the twist top for step 1 and the more manageable flip top for step 2. Overall, I have enjoyed the product and would definitely consider purchasing again.

  991. I received full size tubes of Crest pro-health HD 2 step whitening toothpaste from BzzAgent for free. This though, is just 2 tubes of toothpaste that you apply to all of your teeth the same way you would normally brush your teeth. The Step 1 tastes and feels just like a normal fluoride toothpaste. You brush for 1 minute then spit. The Step 2 is a clear gel that definitely lets you know you are using something different. The taste is not great, but it is not unbearable either. I felt a tingle in my mouth and on my gums as I was brushing for 1 minute with it. As I read the box, I'm assuming this must be the hydrogen peroxide in the product. The box does state that you may feel some sensitivity to it in the beginning. Except for the slight tingle While brushing with Step 2, I did not notice a discomfort while using it or after. After the very first brushing, my teeth felt like I had just left the dentists' office ( the good feel). After the 4th day of using it twice a day, I do notice my teeth whitening and I am getting more used to the taste and tingle of Step 2.   992. After using this product twice daily for about two weeks, I have noticed a slight improvement in the whiteness of my teeth. I've never tried any sort of professional or at-home whitening kits or toothpastes before, so this was my first go around with any sort of product. I have a permanent cap on one of my front teeth that was done almost 15 years ago, while the color change of the surrounding teeth has not been dramatic over the years, I've become a fan of coffee and tea in that time, so there is a bit of discoloration from those dietary habits. There has been no negative impact on the cap, something I've always been a bit nervous about damaging, and the rest of the teeth have lightened up a bit, but not startlingly so.<br /><br />Advantages:<br />- Even with very hot / cold sensitive teeth, I have not noticed any increased sensitivity while using this product. This is something that many folks who use whitening products report, but this seems to be fairly gentle on the teeth overall while still providing some whitening.<br />- Simple to use system - start with the 1st step, brush, spit then add step 2 to your brush and continue brushing. Spit, rinse, and you're done.<br />- Provided a noticeably whiter smile after just 2 weeks of using twice a day. Not super dramatic, but I can tell a difference, especially using my permanent cap as a guide.<br /><br />Disadvantages:<br />- I am really sensitive to the aspartame taste and this definitely has it, but it is subtle and not overwhelming. Just wish they'd use a sugar alcohol in place, but I'm sure there's a reason.<br />- If I store the tubes on their caps, so they stand up properly on the counter, the toothpaste will goop up around the nozzle / opening a bit. Nothing too bad, but I hate a messy toothpaste tube.<br /><br />Overall, I'd recommend this to someone who is looking to start a whitening regime but isn't sure where to start. It's a gentle enough product for sensitive teeth, provides a good clean feeling, and is as simple as switching up your toothpaste - none of those extra strips or mouth pieces to fool with.s as simple as switching up your toothpaste - none of those extra strips or mouth pieces to fool with.

  997. I am four nights into my trial of Crest Pro Health HD and I wanted to share my initial thoughts on this product. In the sake of full disclosure, I did receive a free sample of this product through BzzAgent.<br /><br />A bit about me: I am a coffee drinker, but not a smoker. I have tried a variety of whitening products in the past (toothpastes, strips, gels). I'd have to say this ranks about the same, not a life shattering change by any stretch.<br /><br />Pros/Positive Aspects:<br />- Yes, when I am done my teeth feel silky smooth, like I just left the dentist.<br />- My mouth doesn't have as much of that morningy 'funk' each morning as it normally does. Maybe it's related to using this product, maybe not.<br /><br />Cons/Complaints:<br />- Bleh. The taste is not good. I want my regular toothpaste taste, please.<br />- Step two has a twist on cap. If I am in the middle of brushing w/ step one, I am to then spit, but not rinse. How do I open and close the step 2 container while brushing? Sure, sure I can open it before I get started and close it after I am all done, but that's not how I operate and this peeves me. There should be a flip cap on the step 2 tube.<br />- It is slightly disconcerting to put the liquidy gel (step 2) across your tooth brush and in your mouth. It's not like toothpaste, and mentally, I have a barrier to it being something I should be puttingin my mouth.<br />- I read the label and now I'm perturbed. Step 2 contains Sucralose... the artificial sweetener (in my opinion - likely a cancer causing agent). This is probably why step 2 tastes terrible (as sucralose and aspertame in yogurts and other foods often tastes nasty to me), no clue why step 1 tastes nasty. Yes, I know we're not actually 'consuming it', but you do end up ingesting a little. Further, I should already be concerned with fluoride in general, but, it is a concession I have made to prevent cavities, I'm not comfortable with the sucralose and that is reason enough to state that after this trial I will NOT remain a crest pro health hd customer.<br /><br />Needless to say my rinse after step 2 is WAY more thorough than my old brushing routine was.state that after this trial I will NOT remain a crest pro health hd customer.<br /><br />Needless to say my rinse after step 2 is WAY more thorough than my old brushing routine was.

Adding a 2nd step to the brushing routine adds too much extra time that I've had to adjust for. As a parent of a small child who needs my constant attention, time is everything! Overall, I feel really good about using the system and am happy about the results thus far. I will be continuing to use the system until I have no more left.   1009. This is a simple two-step brushing process: use tube 1 for one minute, then tube 2 for another minute, without rinsing in between. Over a two-week period of twice-daily usage, it does produce noticeably whiter teeth, even if you're a coffee addict. The flavor is pleasant, the process is simple and it's really a matter of just switching out from regular toothpaste with no need for teeth guards or anything complicated. It doesn't whiten as much as targeted (and expensive) whitening products over the same time frame.<br /><br />At this stage, I don't know the price of this product but I can say it performs similarly to Arm & Hammer's bicarbonate of soda toothpaste, which is around $3-4 a tube in supermarkets. There is a difference in taste and I know some people cannot stand the A&H substitute but it definitely whitens very effectively. If budget is an issue (or this product is as expensive as the boxed packaging suggests), it might be a good alternative.

  1023. I received a sample of Crest Pro-Health HD Daily Two-Step to try by the company. Having white, beautiful teeth is important to me because I have a big smile that's one of the first things people notice about me. While I don't drink coffee or smoke, I have some moderate yellowing particularly on my canine teeth. I was excited to try this toothpaste to see if I could help eliminate some of the yellowing and maybe brighten my teeth overall. Each kit comes with two tubes of toothpaste - Step 1 is the typical toothpaste and Step 2 is a finishing polish. You brush with Step 1 for one minute, spit out the toothpaste and do not rinse, then brush with Step 2 for 1 minute, spit and rinse. I did this twice a day - morning and night - in place of my regular toothpaste. I have an electric toothbrush that lets me know when I've brushed for a minute so that helped me with the timing of the two steps. I followed the exact process for seven days. The Step 1 toothpaste has a sweet, minty flavor. I prefer strong mint flavors so this was something that took a little getting used to for me. The Step 2 finishing polish did not have too much of a taste, it was just a slight mint. My teeth felt clean afterwards, no filmy residue was left behind. I also noticed fresh breath which is very important to me when I use a new toothpaste. So after a week, I noticed a slightly brighter smile. The results were not overwhelming, my teeth still have a slight yellow tinge on a few teeth but I do believe it lightened them a bit. I think for someone looking for a little bit of brightening would enjoy this product. If you're expecting miracles and celebrity-white teeth, consult a dentist for professional whitening products. It's important to note, I did not have any tooth sensitivity with this product. I've used whitening products in the past and have noticed some sensitivity to hot and cold but this toothpaste did not cause any issues for me.

  1043. My latest and what I thought would be greatest product I received (for free!) from BzzAgent was the new Crest Pro Health HD system. This product has two steps: Tube 1, you brush for one minute. It is supposed to remove plaque and help prevent gingivitis, etc. After brushing for one minute, you spit but don't rinse. Tube 2, you also brush for one minute. This is the polishing agent. This step is supposed to activate the whitening and brightening aspects of the system. You are supposed to use twice a day for at least a week and teeth should be up to six shades whiter. So now you've heard all of the &#34;supposed to&#34;. In reality, I wasn't as impressed with this product as I thought I would be. I found that the two step system left my gums feeling very sensitive after the first few uses, so I couldn't use twice a day. I used once a day and then used a toothpaste for sensitive teeth at night to counteract the sensitivity caused by the Crest Pro Heath HD system. For this reason, I used it longer than just six days. While it probably maintained my original color, I didn't see any significant difference in the whiteness or brightness of my teeth. Six shades, to me, is a significant difference. I guess I just expected to have these brilliant white teeth after using the product. Now I consider my teeth to be a pretty average white/off-white (however you consider it), so I didn't need a major whitening, but I feel like I didn't really see any whitening at all. I will say a few positive things about the product though: The two step system makes your teeth feel SUPER clean, which I love! My dentist made me start using a soft bristle tooth brush a while back because I had some gum erosion. I liked my hard bristle tooth brush, because my teeth were always very clean & my teeth cleanings were minimal. I feel like the soft bristle tooth brush just doesn't get my teeth as smooth and clean as I would like. The Crest Pro Health HD gives me back that polished feeling. And step two is foamy and tastes pretty decent too. I like that foamy bubbly feeling from my toothpaste that makes you feel like it's getting your teeth really clean, and some of the other whitening toothpastes don't do that. For these reasons, I will score it at three stars.<br />So overall, not a product I'm going to go out and purchase myself but not a bad score from BzzAgent.eling. And step two is foamy and tastes pretty decent too. I like that foamy bubbly feeling from my toothpaste that makes you feel like it's getting your teeth really clean, and some of the other whitening toothpastes don't do that.   1071. I'm someone who is diligent about oral hygiene. I have been using an electric toothbrush for years, floss nightly, and visit my dentist every six months religiously. Needless to say I was excited to try out the two-step Crest Pro Health® HD(tm) system.<br /><br />The routine did take a bit of getting used to. First, you apply Step 1, a purifying cleanser, and brush for one minute. (FYI, you are allowed to spit but not rinse after this step.) Then you add Step 2, a perfecting gel that is for polishing and whitening, and brush for an additional minute. My electric toothbrush helped me keep track since every 30 seconds it makes a noise. Other than adding a second toothpaste to my routine, it didn't feel much different from my regular brushing regimen.<br /><br />In terms of the \\"feel,\\" the first step does feel a bit drying to the mouth, but the taste is a subtle mint not unlike many other toothpastes. The second step leaves more of a \\"just back from the dentist\\" feel rather than a \\"just brushed with traditional toothpaste\\" feel. The first night I felt a little thrown by the lack of true mint flavor and swirled a bit of mouthwash after I was done brushing. That helped a bit, but by the second day I was used to the flavor.<br /><br />What impressed me most about this toothpaste was its staying power overnight. I woke up in the morning with NO horrible morning breath taste in my mouth! This was an awesome. I'm a nursing mom and have to get up several times in the night to feed the baby, so not to have that gross taste in my mouth during those night feedings was a huge plus.<br /><br />As for the whitening, I can't say that my teeth are any whiter after over a week of use, but they weren't that stained to begin with. I will say that I have used Crest whitening strips in the past and had great results. If you are looking to whiten your teeth, I would stick to those. For me, I was much more interested in the health aspects of the Crest Pro Health® HD(tm)toothpaste, so I still feel like the system is a good upgrade from my normal brushing routine.<br /><br />*Thanks to the generosity of Crest, I was able to try this product for free*l feel like the system is a good upgrade from my normal brushing routine.<br /><br />*Thanks to the generosity of Crest, I was able to try this product for free*

  1076. I found there to be some very strong pros and very strong detractors to this toothpaste. The two-step system is kind of a pain to use if you don't have a way to manage the amount of time you are supposed to be brushing with each paste; I use a Sonicare so it beeps every thirty seconds and is handy for knowing when to switch from step one to step two. The taste of this toothpaste is, like most whitening pastes, not great; the second step in particular tastes very strongly of peroxide. My biggest issues comes from using the Sonicare toothbrush with this. The pastes did not stay on the brush well and therefore didn't disperse well around my mouth/teeth. The second step was the most troublesome with this issue and would just sit in one spot, requiring some fancy maneuvering to get it around. Crest Pro-Health HD toothpaste is a great way to whiten your teeth, I have to say that I have tried other product but never had great success and could never bring myself to spend money to have my teeth professionally whitened. So, when I was given the opportunity to try this product I was very excited but apprehensive at the same time.<br /><br />To my surprise, I love this product, I have cant tell you how easy it is, you simply throw away your old toothpaste and replace it with Crest Pro Health HD, you brush your teeth twice a day for two minutes, using step one and step two! Yes, its that easy, and within the first cleaning you feel your mouth is much fresher and cleaner, then within days you can see that your teeth are getting whiter!<br /><br />There are only two negatives, one being that the toothpaste for step 1 is a little thick and feels like there is sand in it, but that you can get over since you only use it for one minute at a time. Second, you teeth can be sensitive after brushing, so no drinking water for about 15 minutes after your brush! In all honesty these two things are minimal and so worth dealing with because you get healthier and whiter teeth in such a simple way.<br /><br />Thank you to BzzAgent for giving me the opportunity to try/sample this product, its has truly helped improve my teeth and confidence. #HealthyObsession #Sponsored #GotItFree
  1079. When I recieced my free sample of Crest Pro Health HD, I was skeptical. I have used many whitening toothpastes in the paste and find that they don't whiten so much as prevent further yellowing. After using Crest Pro Heath HD twice a day for over a week now I have notice a good amount of whitening! The kit comes with 2 separate tubes of toothpaste. The first is a tradional toothpaste meant to clean the teeth. I The second tube, that you use immediately after brushing with the first, contains a clear whitening gel. Overall I am pretty satisfied with the product, and would recommend it to anyone who wanted a toothpaste that actually does a decent job whitening. The only drawback is that because it has separate tubes it takes twice as long to brush my teeth now.

  1081. Full disclosure: I got this product to try from BzzAgent.<br />I've always taken good care of my teeth, brushing twice a day no matter what. This is certainly a good way to go about making your smile whiter and look cleaner compared to other expensive methods.<br />However, I've never liked the taste of Crest products and while I've gotten used to it some, it is still weird and too sweet. The Step1 product isn't too bad, but the Step2 protective gel is strongly sweet from the flouride or something. I don't know why Crest insists on keeping the same taste all these years.<br />Now, on the flip side, once you are done and rinse our your mouth, it really does feel clean and fresh.<br />The part I worry about is long-term use though in that typically products that whiten teeth are wearing on the enamel/surface of the teeth, so users that have high wear on their teeth (from night grinding or what have you) may be weary.<br />Anyway, the product does seem to do what it says: Whitens teeth, leaves them clean and bright.<br /><br />Minus 1 star for the typical Crest taste.

This is the one with little funky taste but it is also the one which is responsible for cleaning out the stains and yellowness from your teeth. Knowing my teeth will shine brighter, the taste does not seem so bad.<br /><br />Overall, I say it's worth a try. The only draw back i can think of is maybe that the price is a little on the higher side just for toothpaste so i am taking away one star just for that.   1091. Thanks to Crest, I got to try this product for free because I am a Bzzagent. I really wanted to love this new toothpaste. Unfortunately, I don't love stannous fluoride. Years ago I was obsessed with the idea of Crest Pro-Health, so I went out and purchased the whole whole of products. After using it twice a day for two weeks, my pearly whites turned dingy green. I also had issues with the toothpaste peeling the top layer of skin from the inside of my cheeks and lips after each use- gross! I was hoping that this toothpaste wouldn't have the same problems, but it does. My first experience with this product was pretty negative. Step 1 hurt my gums. The 30 minutes after brushing my teeth, I had that nasty layer of skin peeling off from inside my mouth. This is a side-effect from the active ingredient on the toothpaste. I can't deal with it, so I unfortunately won't be using the toothpaste (step 1) again. Now step 2, the whiting/polishing gel is a cool product. I would purchase this product on its own. It is a peroxide based gel which is meant to whiten your teeth. I can also see this product counteracting the effects of the toothpaste, helping to avoid the green stains caused by the toothpaste. Today I used the whitening gel in place of my usual gel in my teeth whitening tray. The gel was cooling and minty. I left the tray in for about 5 minutes. I had the usual foaming action that I see with my usual whitening gel, but to a slightly lesser degree. The mint flavor made the whitening process kind of enjoyable. I noticed that my teeth were about 1/2 shade lighter which isn't bad at all. The step 2 in this system was nice and gentle, so I would use it a few times a week for about 5 minutes and probably see significantly whiter teeth in about 2 weeks. So all in all, I hated the toothpaste and loved the gel. I hope that crest starts to sell these products separately.

Open tube one and brush for one minute, spit but do not rinse. I , out of habit rinsed the first few times by accident. Next apply tube 2 and brush for one minute, then spit and rinse. It is literally that easy. I used for 5 days and my teeth felt great but then on the 6th day I noticed my gums were getting irritated and got white spots so I took a 3 day break and resumed.   1115. I received this from a Crest rep to try out. Let me preface this with the fact that I am a dental hygienist. This is like the other Crest Pro Health toothpastes in that it is one that will cause mucosal sloughing in some individuals (meaning that the insides of your mouth may shed like a snake). Not sure what ingredient in the Pro Health line does this, but I've noticed it both personally and in my patients with these products, including this one with the first step paste.<br /><br />The second thing of note: don't use this if you are sensitive to whitening agents. The second step is essentially a low dose whitening gel and can cause some to feel anything from a range to slight discomfort or severe pain. After one use, I could already feel some of my teeth feel more sensitive to cold air and water.<br /><br />As some other reviewers have noted, the active ingredient, Stannous Fluoride, can stain the teeth. Stannous fluoride is notorious for this and could potentially stain some individuals teeth.<br /><br />Finally, the flavor is not all that great! If this toothpaste works for you, then that's great, but just making some notes for those who may have gum or tooth sensitivity.

I would recommend this product and the opinions in this review are 100% my own

  1125. This product is amazing. Its pretty mild - not really much flavor. Without rinsing, you then brush for 1 minute with tube 2 - the polisher/whitener. Simple enough.   1143. Crest Pro-Health HD Two-Step Toothpaste System is a two-step tooth-cleaning process that requires minimal time to complete. The steps are simple: brush with the fluoride toothpaste for one minute, spit (but do not rinse), then brush with the hydrogen peroxide gel for an additional minute. The expectation is that you will use the system morning and night, totaling four minutes a day of oral care (not including flossing and all the other stuff you might or might not do).<br /><br />I can honestly say that my teeth have never felt cleaner than when I used this system with my Spinbrush classic. My teeth literally felt like perfectly buffed pearls in my mouth. I can only imagine how well the system works with one of the more high-tech brushes (sonic) applying the pastes.<br /><br />My complaint is in regard to the whitening claim. I literally saw no change in how white my teeth were even after weeks of use. This may be because I have used Crest Whitestrips within the past two years, or it may just be that whatever has caused the discoloration of my teeth isn't affected by hydrogen peroxide. Whatever the case, I can't recommend this whitening toothpaste for its whitening properties - though it still does an impressive job of cleaning teeth.
  1144. I got this toothpaste for free from Crest to try. I was excited about trying this product, after all who's teeth couldn't use some whitening. I told my 10 year old daughter about it.
