Tube 2 is the whitening/polishing gel, it almost has a fruity flavor, it reminded me of the gel fluoride treatments I got as a kid. On and on we went morning and night for 6 days. It was actually quite fun all 3 of us brushing together to the timer. :) After the first day I could tell my teeth were cleaner than normal. It does work good at polishing!   1146. I received a sample kit of the Crest HD system through BzzAgent. I did use the product for two weeks following the directions. The bottom line is that the product is somewhat more difficult to use<br /><br />If you notice there are two parts to this system. Step 1 is the cleaning step. It is a very thin paste with a very strong mint flavor. After 1 minute you stop brushing and put step 2 onto your toothbrush. It is important not to rinse between steps. Step 2 is a bleaching gel and doesn't taste very good, the strong flavor of step 1 helps mask the poor taste. After another minute you are done and you rinse as normal.<br /><br />I use a Sonicare toothbrush, and unfortunately mine does not have the feature that beeps every 30 seconds. That would have made the switch at 1 minute easier to time. I relied on counting to 60 because I would repeatedly forget to bring a watch in with me. This two part system is a little more inconvenient than normal toothpaste, but probably better than whitening trays. It wouldn't have been a problem, except I didn't see a difference in my tooth color after 2 weeks. For me, it was not worth the hassle.<br /><br />My mouth did feel clean, but I did not like the aftertaste or the sensation left by the bleaching agent.<br /><br />I also found the packaging to be strange. Crest spent more time with the technical requirements of the bleaching paste than they did the use of the entire system. Step 1 is a flip cap that is easy to open. Step 2 is a screw cap that if you forget to open before you brush, is hard to open one handed. And this shouldn't matter at all, but the label on step 2 is upside down if you place the tube on the flat part of the cap, the opposite of step 1.<br /><br />Finally, after 2 weeks of using this product, I had increased sensitivity. I was glad to go back to a one tube sensitivity Crest product.<br /><br />I applaud Crest for indulging somebody's new idea. It just doesn't deliver enough of a difference in results to make up for the extra hassle.in results to make up for the extra hassle.

  1165. Crest Pro Health HD comes with two tubes that are marked Step 1 and Step 2. The tubes are also different colors (silver and blue) so you don't mix them up, which is a nice touch. Step 1, the &#34;Purifying Cleanser,&#34; is the larger, silver tube, and it's like a regular toothpaste. It's nice and minty and a slightly aqua or blue color like some mint gel toothpastes are. You brush your teeth with this first for 1 minute, and spit but do not rinse with water. Step 2, the &#34;Perfecting Gel,&#34; is in a smaller, blue tube. It's a clear, somewhat runny or watery gel. You brush with this second step for 1 minute, spit (but don't rinse), and brush for 1 minute more. This gel tastes more like a product from the dentist's office. It's not bad per se, but not nice and minty like regular toothpaste. More of a medicinal taste, which is kind of unfortunate since it's the last taste you have in your mouth as Step 2. One thing I liked about these products is that you feel more inclined to brush for longer; they recommend 3 minutes total of brushing (1 for the cleansing, and 2 for the purifying gel). My mouth felt really clean afterwards. The tubes are small, though. My husband and I usually share 1 tube of toothpaste in the master bathroom, and I feel like this would be gone very quickly if two people used it. I have used the Crest Whitestrips product in the past. In my experience, those strips whitened my teeth faster and more noticeably. This Pro Health HD product seems to me better at reducing stains or maintaining whiteness than whitening itself. I didn't see any dramatic improvement, but my mouth feels clean. I got a free sample of the product from Crest.
  1166. As I have found most whitening systems do not work. But I fell in love with the crest 2 step system. It works great. First of all I love that it has the everyday toothpaste that cleans and keeps mouth healthy. I definitely recommend this to those who are looking for an easy option to maintain a bright healthy white smile.
  1167. I have been using Crest ProHealth HD for 4 weeks thanks to a free system from Crest and BzzAgent. I can reiterate what many other reviewers appear to be saying - although my teeth do feel very clean with use of this product, I haven't experienced any noticeable difference in the health of my mouth or the whiteness of my teeth.<br /><br />The primary innovation of this toothpaste seems to be that, as it has two steps, it causes me to brush for twice as long as I otherwise would. It also contains hydrogen peroxide in the perfecting gel, which of course is a proven effective whitening and oral debriding agent.<br /><br />The primary mark against this toothpaste is the price. Yes, it works, but it doesn't work any more effectively than my regular toothpaste, which costs about a third of what this system does. I also take exception to the amount of packaging that this toothpaste entails (I feel very wasteful) and I'm leery of stannous fluoride, which may actually stain the teeth.<br /><br />My overall score for this toothpaste is 3/5 stars. It works, and my mouth feels clean and tastes pleasant - but I could achieve the same effects with much less expense.
  1168. Crest Pro Health HD is awesome. I received it free as part of a sampling/review program from BzzAgent and I’m glad I did. I went to the dentist last Thursday for my 6 month check up, I had been using Crest pro Health HD for about 4 weeks prior. I never said anything to the dental hygienist, but she commented on how little plaque I had on my teeth and that I had been doing an excellent job brushing. I’m not known to be the greatest brusher and I’ve never received a complement from the dentist or hygienist before. Crest Pro Health HD is a keeper.
  1169. When I got a free box of the Crest Pro-Health HD Daily Two Step Toothpaste from Crest through bzzagent, I was skeptical. I had used whitening toothpastes before without much difference and I had tried the strips and I never seemed to be able to follow through on those to get them to work well. I had a box of strips that had been sitting, unused, next to my sink for a few months, so I decided to give the Crest Pro-Health HD Toothpaste a try. I read the directions, which I am glad I did, because you use the step 1 for a minute (the fluoride toothpaste to protect against cavities & gingivitis) and then you spit it out, but you do not rinse (It took a few rounds of this before it because second nature not to rinse with water). Then you use the Step 2 for a minute (a whitening gel that contains hydrogen peroxide). You rinse after this step is complete. Within a few days, I thought my teeth looked whiter. I drink a lot of tea and some soda and my teeth tend to lose their shine and get a bit of a dingy look to them. After I had been using the Crest Pro Health HD for a couple weeks, my mom came into town and one of the first things she said to me was to ask if I had had my teeth whitened. The product is very simple to use and it produced results for me. You brush your teeth as long as you normally would (two minutes total each brushing), so there's no added time or inconvenienced like you can have with strips or other whitening methods. I am also not a fan of my toothpaste flavors, but this has a light minty taste that did not bother me at all. My first box may have been free, but I have continued using it on my own.
  1170. At first I was hesitant to try a 2-step system for a toothpaste. However, considering it takes only 2 minutes total, I quickly got over my hesitancy. The step 1 fluoride is exactly what I need - removes plaque and reduces gingivitis. The step 2 hydrogen peroxide gel is great for removing surface stains. If you are a coffee and wine-drinker like I, you will benefit from and appreciate this toothpaste combo. I tend to be sensitive to whitening toothpastes, and my teeth didn't tingle when using this step. I gave it 4 rather than 5 stars because I think the mint flavor could be a bit stronger. However, my mouth still feels clean after using the HD system. I personally just like a stronger, more pungent flavor. I did receive this toothpaste free courtesy of Crest but all opinions are my own.
  1171. I tried this product as part of a BzzAgent promotion. Unfortunately the results were average at best. Although it did leave my breath fresh, the whitening affect was minimal, only slightly noticeable after two weeks of use. Having to use two tubes is a bit of a hassle, the second tube doesn't have a flip top which might have eased the annoyance slightly. It doesn't taste all that good either. Overall though, I did feel like my teeth were clean after using the product, but I'm not sure the extra cost is justified by the limited additional benefits.
  1172. I received a free package of Crest Pro Health HD toothpaste as a BzzAgent to try out and give my opinion. My teeth were noticeably whiter after a week of using this toothpaste twice a day. After five weeks, my teeth are still whiter than before and I'm happy with the product. Plus, it is super easy! No messy, annoying whitening strips. Simply brush for one minute using Step 1 and then brush for another minute using Step 2. Then your done. I was a bit concerned that my sensitive teeth would have a problem switching to a new toothpaste (I have used Sensodyne for over 10 years) but I have had no issues with my teeth for the last five weeks. Love this produce and highly recommend it!
  1173. So full disclosure, I received Crest Pro Health® HD™ toothpaste for free to try as part of a promotion with Crest and BzzAgent. With that out of the way, I will explain to those unfamiliar with this product that the two-step process involves one minute of brushing with the cleaning toothpaste and then one minute of brushing with the polishing/whitening gel. The cleaning toothpaste seems to be comparable to other Crest products. The whitening gel also seems similar to home whiteners. The fact that it is a two-step process is an extremely minor inconvenience, though when you have an electric toothbrush (as I do) it simplifies things. I know that after it buzzes twice it's time to move onto step 2.<br />I find the taste to be inoffensive. It's not great, but I don't really expect toothpaste or teeth whiteners to have a pleasant taste. The step 1 toothpaste is a little on the gritty side, if that's something that bothers you.<br />In any case, I will say that I was really glad I got this opportunity because my teeth definitely look whiter. It's not as stunning of a difference as I saw with some other people's reviews, but I definitely noticed whiter teeth after using the Crest Pro Health® HD™ for 30 days. I think my teeth weren't that yellow to begin with, so maybe a less dramatic change is to be expected. I guess that's the only reason I'm giving 4 stars rather than 5.

  1180. It is always an exciting day when the BzzAgent box arrives in the mail. In this box was the new Crest Pro Health HD. And that is about where the excitement came to an end. Now I can't say for sure if the enamel is being stripped, but I have successfully lived by going with my gut feeling. After using this product, I did not see any difference in the white of my teeth.   1183. I got to try this toothpaste through BuzzAgent and I'm glad I did because I would have never thought that I needed a 2 step cleaning process for healthier teeth. This makes sense because when you go to a dentist, you get cleaned with that scraper tool and then the dentist polishes your teeth with some product. Anyways, the 2 step process feels clinical and it does take a bit more time and effort, but when I do it, I feel a bit like a dentist. Step 1 is the toothpaste part, getting rid of plaque and polishing the teeth. Step 2 is the clinical part, where it's whitening the teeth from all the food that you eat. I felt a little less guilty about drinking tea or coffee when I do this step. Step 2 does have a weird smell and I feel like it stings my mouth a bit, but I don't think any harm is done. Try this product if your regular toothpaste isn't whitening your teeth as you wish or if you don't want to buy a separate whitening and harsh product. This feels more seamless and more subtle. I use my regular 1 step toothpaste when I'm in a hurry and use this one at night when I have a bit more time.

The Crest Pro Health® HD™ only requires a minute per step but that means I have to stop the toothbrush cycle mid way. Overall not a bad product as far as a whitening toothpaste.
  1218. I was given the opportunity to try out and review the Crest Pro-Health HD Two Step product and am extremely glad I was given this opportunity by Crest. First I was slightly worried about using a two step process as I've been brushing my teeth the same way for 30 years, after the first couple of times it has become my only toothpaste, to the point where my wife is now using it also and I've had to another pack! I noticed a brighter smile in about a week, and after two weeks I must say it is at least 2 shades whiter than prior to use. Friends has asked me if I was whitening and I said technically yes, and explained the process, some had seen the commercial on TV and knew what I was talking about. The process is extremely simple, brush using step 1 which is just regular toothpaste I believe, do not rinse and brush using step two which is the whitening product which is a gel. I did notice that after the rinsing with the step two Gel there was a bit of an aftertaste that went away shortly thereafter, not nearly as bad a generic toothpaste. From a price point, this is an fairly expensive product for those of us who have used off the shelf Crest before, it retails for between $12-15, and the tubes are smaller than normal toothpaste and last about half the time, roughly about two weeks as opposed to about a month for a normal size tube. However this is a whitening product and as such being cosmetic I would expect it to be a bit on the higher side, but not as high as Crest's competitors pricing. All in all I feel confident that I will continue to use Crest Pro-Health HD, since it does the job and does it really well.

However, the packaging did not have a cheap appearance and looked premium.<br /><br />Crest Pro Health HD consists of two parts. Part one is a cleaner and part two is a whitening gel. You are supposed to brush with part one for 1 minute, spit, and brush with part two for 1 minute. The directions were clearly written and easy to understand the two separate steps. After using the Crest Pro Health, my mouth and teeth feel cleaner and healthier than before. Part of the reason might be because I have been brushing for 2 minutes, which I was not always diligent about doing. However, I feel Crest Pro Health HD had a bigger impact on the clean feeling than additional brushing time.<br /><br />The part that I was dissapointed about was the whitening. I have not noticed a visible difference in my whiteness, even after 4 weeks of usage. I also did not get any comments from others about my teeth whiteness. The other negative was my teeth were sensitive about 2 weeks after using the product. I had the same reaction to teeth whitening strips in the past. The sensitivity went away after about 1 week.<br /><br />I also convinced my wife to be a trial subject because she is interested in teeth whitening and dental health. Like me, she did not notice her teeth getting whiter. However, she thought it makes her teeth feel cleaner and less &#34;slimy&#34;. She is very diligent about brushing for 2 minutes, so the Crest Pro Health HD is the reason for a non-slimy mouth. She enjoyed the product and would recommend it for this reason.<br /><br />Overall, Crest Pro Health HD makes your mouth feel healthier and cleaner, but in our case did not seem to make our teeth whiter. I was hoping for better whitening capabilities, but would recommend using it if you want cleaner, healthier teeth.joyed the product and would recommend it for this reason.<br /><br />Overall, Crest Pro Health HD makes your mouth feel healthier and cleaner, but in our case did not seem to make our teeth whiter.   1245. I'm a BzzAgent and got a full size CrestPro Health HD to try and report on. It states you will have brighter teeth in a week and I found that to be true!   1246. I have been using the Crest Pro Health HD for several weeks now. First thing I noticed after using the product is that my teeth felt extremely clean. I was excited to continue using the product to see the results. After a few days using the product day and night, I began to notice white spots on my gums. I discontinued use for several days to see if the product was the cause. The spots went away after stopping using the product. I tried again for another week. This time I didn't notice any white spots on my gums, but my teeth were extremely sensitive when eating anything crunchy or chewy. I totally stopped using the product after this. Overall, the product seems to do its job by cleaning and whitening the teeth. Although my teeth only showed minimal whitening before I had to discontinue use. I imagine every person will be different, maybe this product just wasn't right for me. For anyone looking for a simple system to clean and whiten your teeth, I would recommend this. You are not supposed to rinse in between using the 2 tubes. I loved the taste of the cleanser and tasted somewhat like spearmint, which was so refreshing. The polishing tube has somewhat of a metallic taste, but like I mentioned, my teeth felt super clean afterwards.   1257. So this may seem weird but I was super excited to receive this toothpaste for free via BzzAgent and Crest. I have been a Crest user my entire life and was looking forward to trying this new product with the added bonus of better mouth health and whiter teeth! The first thing anyone will notice is that the Crest Pro Health HD is actually two tubes, one which has the cleaning paste (which is basically like normal toothpaste) and the other which is a polishing paste. The instructions clearly state that you must brush with the toothpaste for 1 minute, spit but not rinse, then continue brushing for an additional minute with the polish. This is a somewhat strange procedure, I think not necessarily because it is a hardship or bad, but because it's not the usual routine. For me, I found it awkward because I use an electric toothbrush which automatically turns on for 2 minutes of brushing so to pause the toothbrush halfway through it's interval is a bit weird. It's also a bit annoying because I really can't be bothered to count out the 1 minute or set a standalone timer/cell phone to time it. However, this is a relatively minor issue.<br /><br />The product claims to provide whiter teeth in 1 week and to reduce gingivitis (in 3 weeks) and plaque and this is what sets it apart from existing toothpastes and whiteners already on the market. I'm not sure about the gingivitis as it's hard to tell, but I do think my teeth are slightly whiter after using it for 10 days. I think that the biggest advantage of this system is that it's fairly affordable compared to whitening strips or professional whitening. It is also painless and doesn't require sitting around with strips for 20 minutes awkwardly waiting for the whitening reaction to take place. I personally did not have a problem with the taste or texture of either step 1 or step 2. In fact, I found step 1 to be reminiscent of the kids Crest gel toothpaste.<br /><br />The one tip I would give is that because you are only brushing with each step for a minute, you really have to make a conscious effort to reach all surfaces of your teeth in both steps. I found after a few days that my top teeth were noticeably whiter than my bottom row but was able to correct this with more focuses brushing. Overall, I would say that this product is an innovative whitening alternative but that it may be too much of a hassle for some people. I would recommend it to people who wanted a multi-purpose, affordable way to whiten their teeth while at the same time having more effective cleaning.th each step for a minute, you really have to make a conscious effort to reach all surfaces of your teeth in both steps. I found after a few days that my top teeth were noticeably whiter than my bottom row but was able to correct this with more focuses brushing. Overall, I would say that this product is an innovative whitening alternative but that it may be too much of a hassle for some people. I would recommend it to people who wanted a multi-purpose, affordable way to whiten their teeth while at the same time having more effective cleaning.

It, of course, is very straight forward. Use tube 1 for one minute. Then you can spit, but not rinse, and move on to tube 2, which you use for one minute as well. The consistency of the first tube is more like regular toothpaste. That almost gritty feeling that makes you feel like you are really giving your teeth a good scrubbing. The second tube is more of the polishing finisher; kind of adds that last minute touch of white and clean!!<br />When I first began using the products I did experience some sensitivity to my gums. They were a bit sore and red, but nothing of concern. After about two days and tenderness disappeared completely. I am very impressed with this product.   1265. I had the opportunity to try a free sample of Crest Pro Health® HD™, courtesy of Crest. It did what it said: my teeth were whitened by following the directions. I'm a sleepy person in the morning and for years, I've been letting my electric toothbrush's automatic two-minute timer tell me when I should be done brushing. This product puts a kink in that. I had to remember after a minute to switch gels halfway and sometimes forgot to do so. Overall, it will be just fine, but I learned it wasn't for me since I'd prefer to keep my brushing routine the same.

  1281. If you have tooth sensitivity this toothpaste is not for you. I was given this product to try for free from Crest and I really liked it at first. However after 2 weeks of using this paste just once a day and using my sensitivity toothpaste once a day I found my sensitivity to cold had increased substantially. The sensitivity had become completely unbearable and I had to discontinue its use. It took another 2 weeks of use of my sensitivity toothpaste to get it down to a tolerable level again.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this toothpaste for all those fortunate enough not to have sensitivity issues as it made my teeth very clean, healthy and white. If you are among the unfortunate to have sensitive teeth then I would recommend skipping this product and instead sticking with a sensitivity toothpaste.

  1353. Just started using the Crest Pro Health® HD toothpaste system. What makes the Crest Pro Health® HD system unique is the two step process. My first concern was (A) would I miss a step or (B) would the extra step be a nuisance or too time consuming. As a working mom with my three youngest being 8, 3 and 18 months, my mornings are very hectic and so is bedtime. More complication is not what I am looking for in morning or bedtime routine.<br />Before I even put the toothpaste in my mouth I read the ingredients. For step 1 which is the purifying cleanser, the active ingredient is Stannous Fluoride. Sodium fluoride is the ingredient found in most other toothpastes. Wasn't sure what advantages there were over stannous fluoride, but according to Crests website it differs from sodium fluoride in that it not only helps with cavity protection but also protects against plaque, gingivitis and tooth sensitivity. From my research also found it had more anti-microbial properties.Tooth sensitivity is a problem for me so can't wait to see if this toothpaste will reduce sensitivity. I generally don't like the taste of traditional anti-sensitivity toothpastes, but more on taste of this toothpaste in a little bit.<br />The toothpaste system came in an awesome little package that looked appealing. Most importantly it was easy to open. You could even save the container to store the system. This was what I did to reduce clutter. According to the instructions, you use step 1 for 1 minute and spit but DO NOT rinse. Step 2 is the polishing and whitening gel that you use for another minute. I have an electric toothbrush with timer and didn't find the second step too taxing. You just stop brushing your teeth for a second and add the paste from step 2. If I had to rinse in between steps, that would have definitely been a deal breaker. I would feel like I were brushing my teeth twice. My only criticism is that step 2, the tube should have been a flip top like step 1. Would have made life easier.<br /> The taste of the step one paste was minty, but not overpowering. in fact, I thought it could have been a little stronger. Step 2 had a more harsh taste in my mouth. None of them left any strange aftertaste. I cant say my teeth are noticeable whiter just yet after using for two days, but we will see. Not sure if Crest Pro Health® HD will offer other flavors because that will give consumers a variety to choose from. I did notice that my mouth felt more fresh in comparison to other toothpastes I have used. Most importantly the feeling of freshness even lasted after I ate and several hours later.<br />Crest Pro Health® HD promises to make your mouth up to six times healthier and whiter in a week. In conclusion, if Crest Pro Health® HD can really decrease sensitivity, and increase the whiteness of my teeth with such a simple system, I am sold. Who wants to fiddle with whitening strips and trays, when life could be so much simpler. I received the Crest Pro Health HD free, courtesy of Crest and for being a BzzAgent. However my review is true and unbiased. I will update my review after using for a week.br /> The taste of the step one paste was minty, but not overpowering. in fact, I thought it could have been a little stronger. Step 2 had a more harsh taste in my mouth. None of them left any strange aftertaste. I cant say my teeth are noticeable whiter just yet after using for two days, but we will see.   1356. I received a free product for the purpose of my review. Opinions are 100% my own. I have tried many whitening systems, and. Frankly I think many of them are disgusting. This one though, I really like. It's a two-step process (obviously) but not a difficult one. You use the first tube -- toothpaste -- for one minute. Then, without rinsing (yes, you can spit), add a small bit of the polishing/whitening gel and brush for another minute. That's it. It really is simple, and no more time-consuming than regular tooth brushing. My teeth felt clean, looked clean, and we're super-smooth. I use this every day and have had no issues -- no excessive bleeding, dry mouth, or weird gagging sensation that I can get with strips or trays (if have that issue, you know what I mean). Best of all, my teeth really are cleaner and brighter-looking.

  1363. I am a bzzagent, which means I get to try products for free and share my honest opinions. In other words, spread the buzz.   1364. Thanks to Crest, I was able to try Crest Pro-Health HD for free! I'm glad I got a chance to try it, because this product works really great. It leaves your mouth feeling healthier, plus it also helps whiten teeth. Besides those benefits, this product is designed to reduce cavities, gingivitis, and plaque. And who doesn't want to prevent those things?! You will want to know that this product contains two tubes, to be used each time you brush your teeth. The instructions are to brush teeth for one minute with tube 1 paste, spit but do not rinse, brush for one more minute with tube 2 paste, and then spit and rinse. The tube 2 is for polishing and whitening. For some reason one of the tubes is a flip-top and one is a twist-off. While it may sound slightly complicated, it really takes no more time than a &#34;normal&#34; tooth care routing. There is less foaming of the pastes than regular toothpastes, which I think I prefer. The flavors are minty and fresh. I have been using this product for only a couple of weeks, but so far it leaves my mouth feeling super fresh and healthy with no adverse affects.

  1438. I received a free sample of Crest Pro Health HD as part of a promotion from Crest little over a week ago and I am loving the results.<br />Instead of a traditional toothpaste, this is 2-part product. You brush for 1 minute with the step 1 purifying cleanser, spit, and brush for 1 more minute with the step 2 purifying gel. Basically step 1 contains fluoride and some polishing agents and step 2 is a hydrogen peroxide whitener an anti-tartar ingredient.<br /><br />My mouth feels fresh and clean much longer than with any other toothpaste I have used before. I will say that the 2-step process has taken some getting used to and feels like it takes longer than using a traditional toothpaste, but it really isn't a big deal once you adapt to it. I have also noticed a distinct 'saccharine' taste to the Step 1 gel - not too bad, just definitely sweeter than any other product i have used (I checked the label when writing this review and I was correct, saccharine is an ingredient).<br /><br />Since I am (perhaps more than slightly) neurotic about using new products on/in my body, I did a little bit of research before trying this out. Crest Pro Health HD is formulated with stannous fluoride instead of the traditional sodium fluoride. Stannous fluoride has been around and approved by the FDA for quite a long time. It is actually more effective than sodium fluoride because not only does it strengthen teeth, it is also antimicrobial! On top of that, stannous fluoride can also help to address tooth sensitivity issues. So why hasn't it been used before? It turns out that 1) stannous fluoride is hard to formulate into a stable toothpaste, 2) it can cause removable tooth staining (and maybe other reasons that aren't apparent to me). It seems like crest has solved these problems to bring Crest Pro Health HD to market.

You then use the polishing tooth paste on your teeth for one minute.   1447. This product was reviewed for Bzzagent in which I received the product free to try/review. I was very nervous at first to try Crest Pro Health HD because previously I had used the Pro Health mouth rinse and it stained my teeth. I had to go to the dentist and have them clean my teeth to get the stains off. This product comes with two tubes, one is the toothpaste which contains stannous (tin) fluoride and requires a warning label that it may stain teeth. So I was very nervous that it would stain my teeth. However, the toothpaste did not stain my teeth! I used the toothpaste followed by the whitening gel, twice a day and my teeth were noticeable whiter after 3 days (although I continues using it for 2 weeks). It took at least 3 minutes to do the two step process in the morning and at night and I wasn't quite sure how much whitening gel to use. Since the Crest white strips have to be on your teeth for ~30 minutes, I wasn't sure this would work considering you rinse after about 2-3 minutes but it did work. I still feel that there is some yellow on my teeth near the gum line overall my teeth are whiter. I did notice some sensitivity on my teeth after 3 days, so I cut back to using it once a day and the sensitivity went away. I also used both an power toothbrush and a manual one and both worked well. Overall, this was easier to use than strips and saved time with good results.

  1459. I'm undecided about Crest's Pro-Health HD Two-Step toothpaste. It's minty, it seems to at least cover the basics of giving you clean teeth, but so are regular toothpastes so why this one? It claims to do a better job at cleaning plaque, fighting cavities and gingivitis, and whitening teeth. There I can't say it does or doesn't, as even the product description says regular toothpaste does that too. Where it is supposed to differ is that it is supposed to reduce existing gingivitis and whiten more over three weeks. That remains to be seen, but I also just started using it so time will tell. It does add a certain degree of ritual to your routine if you typically brush and go in the rush to get to work as you're supposed to brush for one minute with one paste then brush for another minute with the other before rinsing. This can't be a bad thing as brushing longer is probably better for you, but not so great if you're running late. Keep in mind I know I should floss, but I generally don't because I find the process tedious and I'm short on time in the morning. Also consider that if you're traveling you now have two bottles to carry with you and they're not travel sized. Not a big deal, but something to think about if you're tight on packing space or trying to reduce clutter. There is nothing truly negative I can say about this toothpaste duo. It's making me be more deliberate about my brushing and if I notice (or more importantly my dentist notices) reduced gingivitis and brighter teeth, then the rating slips up to five stars.

Didn’t like the sensitive feeling but my mouth felt clean.<br />Next I used Step 2, a perfecting gel that is for polishing and whitening, and brush for an additional minute. The second step left my teeth smooth like I &#34;just back from the dentist&#34; feel rather than a &#34;just brushed with toothpaste&#34; feel.
  1491. Absolutely love this duo that I received from Crest to try for free to review! Leaves your mouth feeling like you just got a cleaning from the dentist daily.   1495. I was a bit skeptical when I received a I received a sample of rest Pro Health® HD™ as part of a promotion from the brand. I wondered if the claims of whiter teeth in a few days using this two step toothpaste system. I was very surprised that my teeth were noticeably whiter/lighter and felt as clean as when I just come from the dentist. The steps are easy - you brush with the toothpaste in tube #1 for one minute, spit but don't rinse your toothbrush off, then apply some of the paste in tube #2 and brush for another minute. My teeth definitely felt super clean - like I'd just had them cleaned at the dentist - and after about 1 week I noticed my teeth looked visibly whiter. If I have one complaint it's the flavor or taste of the paste in tube #1. It is a wintergreen flavor and I've never been a fan. I've put up with the taste though because I really like the results.
  1496. I received a free trial of this product through BzzAgent, and was excited to try it because i've been considering whitening products for a while now.   1497. I got some of this toothpaste from Crest to try. After using Crest Pro Health HD for over a week I can't say my teeth are any whiter. I didn't go to the dentist before and after use so I can't say my mouth is healthier. What I can say is that after I brush my teeth they feel smooth and clean like I just had a professional cleaning at the dentist. And that clean, smooth feel lasts all day even after I eat. There are two steps to the brushing process and it takes two minutes. The tubes are labeled with a large 1 and 2, and are different colors - one silver and one blue- but if you miss those subtle clues you will still know if you are holding the right paste because step one has a flip-top toothpaste cap and is minty green like toothpaste, and the second step has a twist cap with a pointy nozzle. So it's pretty much impossible to mess up the order of the steps. You brush first for one minute with the toothpaste which tastes minty and has a very pleasant flavor. Spit, but don't rinse when the minute is up. Then use the second tube which is clear and not very tasty at all. In fact, I would recommend keeping your tongue as far from this clear gel as possible because it does burn slightly. Brush for one minute then spit and rinse. You will then be left with a clean, fresh mouth for the rest of the day. The first few times you use it don't be surprised if you find yourself feeling your teeth with your tongue several times a day just to marvel at how clean they feel.
  1498. Crest Pro-Health HD Daily Two-Step Toothpaste System<br /><br />Step 1 is a sparkling and blue tinted gel that has a nice minty toothpaste taste. Step 2 is the polishing gel and it is an opaque white gel that has a strong mint flavor. Each step asks that you brush for 1 minute with each gel, step 1 for 1 minute, directly followed by step 2 for 1 minute. After you finish with step 2, you are allowed to rinse your mouth. My electronic toothbrush has a 2 minute timer on it so I actually brushed with each step for 2 minutes, as opposed to the instructed 1 minute each for a total of 2 minutes. Since I didn't want to bother with a stopwatch, I just used my toothbrush timer twice.<br /><br />Step 1 feels like I am brushing with normal toothpaste, but step 2 starts to burn a little bit toward the end of brushing. My mouth feels really clean after brushing with a cool and slightly numb feeling. I will say that it does indeed look like it is getting my teeth whiter than normal toothpaste. I will have to see what my dentist says to determine if my teeth and gums are 6X healthier.<br /><br />Note: I did receive this for free for review purposes and this is my honest opinion about this product.

  1516. I recently tried out the Crest Pro Health HD system for free through Crest for the purpose of my review. All opinions remain my own.<br /><br />I can't say I enjoy brushing my teeth and often dislike the taste and texture of toothpastes, so while willing to try a new kind, I was also a little reluctant.<br /><br />The Crest Pro Health HD system comes with two tubes of toothpaste. The first is considered a purifying cleanser designed to strip away plaque. You are to brush with this paste for one minute, spit and add the second tube, a Perfecting Gel, which is designed to whiten your teeth. You brush with the Perfecting Gel for one additional minute and spit and rinse.<br /><br />The nice thing is it only takes two minutes for the entire &#34;system&#34; of cleaning and whitening your teeth.<br /><br />One complaint I find when using this system is the two bottles/tubes have different style lids. One is a flip (the first) and is easy to use. The secnd one requires you to twist and completely remove the lid which seems to be a pain, especially when you have a messy toothbrush in your hands. This seems like a porr design and something that could easily be improved.<br /><br />I have an electric toothbrush that counts to two minutes so the timing is easy for me, however I can see some people struggle with timing of the different minutes.<br /><br />What I do like about this system is it seems to really work. Instantly, my teeth feel cleaner--dentist clean would be the best way to describe it. I can notice my teeth look whiter and I have never noticed a difference in whiteness from another toothpaste. The taste is light and clean...you do taste the hydrogen peroxide flavor at the end but its not overpowering.<br /><br />I recommend the Crest Pro Health HD system for cleaner teeth and a whiter look overall. This seems to be a great system and one that will instantly improve the feeling and cleanliness of your mouth!

  1537. Over the years I've tried a number of whitening products, some that work, but many, many more that don't. The first step looks and goes on like a super-thick regular toothpaste. The product tastes like it should, but feels a little odd in the mouth - kinda gritty and thick. It took a while to get used to not completely getting the product out of my mouth, but once I got used to it it was no big deal. I got total dejavu when using the second step, but I can't for the life of me figure out why. It's a clear gel that you put on top of the residual first step to polish and whiten. But be warned - when they say use for 1 minute, do not go over that 1 minute! The whitening/polishing gel is potent and can irritate your gums and (temporarily) turn them white if left on for too long!<br /><br />Like I said, my teeth didn't need a whole lot of whitening to begin with, but I have noticed that they look a bit brighter since starting this regimen. The minty-ness always leaves my mouth feeling great afterwards, too, which is really what I'm looking for out of any toothpaste. My teeth and gums tend to be particularly sensitive to whitening products, so I probably won't use it again for at least another 6-12 months to keep sensitivity at bay, but I have been quite pleased with it so far. I am about half way through my sample and would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a whitening toothpaste that actually works.ing for a whitening toothpaste that actually works.

I try to brush for at least one minute for each step, but I am seeing very few results as compared to other whitening products I have used in the past. I also don't like the taste of step 2.   1542. I am reviewing a free product I received as a member of Bzzagent. That being said, I have never been happier with toothpaste (at least not since I was about 8 and discovered the glittery crest toothpaste). I agree with what many others are saying about the &#34;fresh from the dentist feeling.&#34; I've noticed this feeling lasts all through the day and even after eating, which isn't something I could say about any other toothpaste I've used to date. Others have complained about brushing taking twice as long.. but really, it's two minutes (that isn't that long) and it's well worth the extended time. My teeth are noticeably whiter, but I am even more impressed with the way my gum health has improved. I highly recommend this product and will be adding it to my regular purchase list.
  1543. I’ve had my buzzkit for Crest Pro Health HD for a few weeks now and I constantly wanted to try it, but I always found myself rushing to get out of the door in the morning. This rushing led to me to stick with the tried and true 1 step brushing process. Eventually, I found myself with a long weekend morning with nothing pressing right after I woke up so I finally tried the Crest Pro Health HD. To my surprise it didn’t take any longer that normal brushing took, just it had an extra step in the process.<br /><br />As far as the process goes to using Crest Pro Health, it is a simple 4 step process – 1 – dry brush with the step 1 tube, 2 – spit, 3 – wet brush with the step 3 tube, 4 - rinse mouth out.<br /><br />At the end of the using the product I found my mouth feeling refreshed and smelling good. One thing I didn’t notice was an increased in dry mouth after each use. Over the course of having used the product for the past week, my teeth seem slightly whiter.<br /><br />Overall, I would recommend the product for someone looking for a 1-2 week course for whitening your teeth and even for someone looking for a whitening tooth paste product.

  1545. I got to try this product free thanks to Crest. I was very excited to try this whitening toothpaste combo, but I was disappointed. To use, you first brush with the 'paste' for 1 minute, then add the whitening 'gel' and brush for another minute. I liked that I could control where I applied the gel, focusing it on my front teeth and avoiding my gums. I was also glad that I didn't notice any sensitivity caused by this product. But I also didn't notice any whitening effects, which defeats the whole purpose. The toothpaste itself also left my mouth feeling rough, and I wasn't a big fan of the taste. I also thought the gel bottle was poorly designed--it was hard to screw on and off the cap while also holding a frothing toothbrush. They should have made that bottle with a flip top like they did the toothpaste bottle. All in all, this product is inconvenient to use, and wasn't very effective. I'll be switching back to regular toothpaste.
  1546. Oral care is very important to me so I was excited to use this product! I received it for free to use it and give my opinion on it. I would have occasional bleeding with flossing and one tooth in particular that felt very sensitive when I flossed it. I do drink a cup of coffee every morning and have noticed some discoloration over the years. I'm not going to lie, I hoped that I would see some difference, after several weeks of use and a before and after picture I didn't see any change in the color of my teeth. I still give it 5 stars because of the clean feeling and overall healthy feeling of my mouth since using this product! This one is definitely a keeper!

  1564. First let me say I am one for WHITE teeth. I like to smile and yellow teeth are not my thing. So does it achieve the goals set forth by Crest? It's plausible. However, as stated above, there are some drawbacks.<br /><br />First of all, it is very cumbersome to use if you use a electric toothbrush. Your toothbrush is timed for two minutes. In your head you are counting to 60, then while the brush is running, (because if you turn it off and back on it starts all over) you rinse and put on step 2. How do you do that with one hand while one is holding on to a vibrating toothbrush? Not easily.<br /><br />The second thing I would change is that the step 2 is a different cap. I actually PREFER the cap for step 2, than the cap for step 1. Anyone who's used Crest recently probably has noticed that the toothpaste tends to leak out of the cap. It's been a topic of discussion with my friends and family for the last few months. Step one has this cap, so it gets to be a gooey mess.<br /><br />Third is , I found the toothpaste has a tendency to burn my mouth. My mouth is far from sensitive however I've found myself stopping the entire process and spitting out before the first minute is done.<br /><br />So to recap, I like the system idea and it seems to be working. My teeth feel clean and do look white. However, the delivery of the system and make up needs some work .

  1571. I am a BzzAgent and received this product to sample as part of BzzAgent campaign. I did actually get some whitening, but it wasn't the dramatic results hyped on the packaging or on the TV commercials. 2) Price.   1587. Let me start by saying that I am a BzzAgent and Crest sent me this product to try for free.<br /><br />When I first received the Crest Pro-Health HD toothpaste, I was very excited, but also very skeptical.<br /><br />I have never used any whitening strips or gels, etc., the only thing I have tried to brighten my smile is a whitening toothpaste. In fact that is the only kind I get from the store. It has to say &#34;whitening&#34; on the box. Although, I'm not sure why I even bothered, because from my experience, I have never used whitening toothpaste that actually made my teeth whiter.<br /><br />However, that has all changed since I started using the Crest Pro Health HD about 6 weeks ago. For the first time in my life, I have noticed that my teeth are actually whiter from a toothpaste, and that is a great feeling! Additionally, my friends and family have noticed it too and want to try this toothpaste now!<br /><br />It's not just whiter teeth I've noticed either. My teeth feel &#34;cleaner&#34;...they are smooth all day, even after I eat! They feel the way they do when I leave the dentist office after having them scraped and polished...which is very painful (at least for me anyway). That &#34;clean&#34; feeling after a dentist visit is the best, but it never lasts more than a few days after brushing with a &#34;normal&#34; toothpaste. So, even though I haven't been to the dentist since using this toothpaste, it feels like I have, which is so awesome! I am even excited to go to the dentist (crazy huh???) to hear what they think of my teeth! I'm curious to find out if my mouth is, in fact, healthier from what it usually is.<br /><br />While this product is great and actually really does work, there are some negatives that I will address:<br /><br />1. It is a 2 step process, which can be annoying, especially in the morning when you are tired and in a hurry.<br /><br />2. My gums were sore and turned whitish in spots for the first few weeks of using this toothpaste. I did stick it out, however I had to cut back to using this product only once a day until my mouth was able to adjust. Personally, I thought of the pain as a good sign that the whitening part was actually working! But, I could see how this would cause someone to stop using it altogether. I guess it just depends on the person and their individual tolerance level. I was willing to deal with a little discomfort because the toothpaste was working and I could see the results.thpaste.   1598. I received this Crest Pro Health HD to try for free as part of BzzAgent. The product consists of a toothpaste and a whitening gel. The directions are to brush at least 2 times a day. Each time you brush, use the toothpaste for 1 minute (you can spit but not rinse) and then use the whitening gel for 1 minute. It's not time consuming or hard to use. It fits in pretty easily to a regular brushing routine. I use a regular manual toothbrush. The toothpaste feels like regular Crest toothpaste and tastes fine. The whitening gel tasted pretty nasty. I definitely wanted to spit out immediately but didn't so I could give the product a chance and judge its effectiveness. It's been over a week and I do not notice a change in my teeth. Friends have not noticed a change in my teeth. My teeth were not terribly discolored to begin with, so maybe it works well for those people. I don't regularly drink coffee or tea. I don't think this product whitens teeth very well. In addition, I found this product on the shelf at a local store and it costs more than the price of 2 toothpaste tubes, so it is not low cost but is cheaper than a whitening procedure at the dentist.

I tried the Crest Pro Health® HD™ And to my surprise, I am very pleased with the results. I used the kit 2x a day for 10 days. While I found it challenging to brush my teeth for 2 full minutes, there was a noticeable difference after. My breath was extremely fresh and my mouth felt much cleaner than with any other toothpaste I've used. My teeth are significantly whiter, the filling matches my natural teeth, and they never became sensitive. The first two days were torture, as my gums were very sensitive. I think it was because I was not used to brushing my teeth that long. The paste left my mouth almost burning from the intense mint, but it was refreshing. I also noticed that the whitening portion left marks on my gums where there was damage, and as time passed by, these spots improved and many disappeared. It helped me to pay more attention to these spots so I can watch for changes. The swelling of my gums decreased as well over the course of 10 days. I would absolutely recommend Crest Pro Health® HD™ to anyone looking to whiten their smile and get a healthier mouth.
  1635. Being a natural toothpaste convert for the past year- the only reason I decided to use the Crest Pro Health HD toothpaste set was because I wanted whiter teeth! I received a free set to test and review from Crest, and it seemed like the best opportunity as I had already thrown out my other, older whitening products without realising that natural toothpastes, baking soda and white vinegar aren't the quickest methods in brightening your smile! The usage is pretty straight forward- you use the tube marked 1 like a regular toothpaste (though this one contains Stannous fluoride which is better against plaque) and brush for 2 minutes, spit it out and without rinsing your mouth or the brush, apply the tube marked 2 on the brush which is the whitening gel and brush for another minute. That's it.<br /><br />I saw a difference within the first 2 days itself of using this set twice a day as usual and in a week's time I had the whitest teeth I've ever had, including a fresh breath and overall clean feeling in my mouth! I did switch back to my natural toothpaste as I'm trying to get rid of my fluoride consumption as much as possible, but use the Crest Pro health HD atleast 2 times a week as maintenance and it seems to be working brilliantly this way! Being a natural toothpaste convert for the past year- the only reason I decided to use the Crest Pro Health HD toothpaste set was because I wanted whiter teeth!<br /><br />The reason I took off a star in my rating is because I began to find the toothpaste (tube 1) too sweet, almost sickeningly so! The set does live up to what it promises on every account- a brighter smile, fresher breath etc, but the taste really gets to me. Another factor I found, which may or not not be connected to this toothpaste combo, would be that I develop a slight pain in my molars each time I use this product, which lasts for about half the day! I haven't been able to thoroughly verify this, but I do know that I don't have any cavities or issues at present. I plan to continue using this product on a twice weekly basis, and will move onto other Crest whitening products when I come to the end of these tubes- probably the Crest 3d white polishing treatment in addition to my current natural toothpaste.<br /><br />I received the Crest Pro Health HD whitening toothpaste for free to use and review from Crest via Bzzagent, and have only presented my honest opinions on the product as a consumer..   1640. I received a sample kit of the Crest HD system through BzzAgent. I did use the product for two weeks following the directions but couldn't manage any longer because of the taste and poorly designed lids.<br /><br />There are 2 parts to this toothpaste: Step 1 is the cleaning step. It is normal toothpaste with refreshing flavor that actually left my teeth feeling pretty clean. After 1 minute you stop brushing and put step 2 onto your toothbrush without rinsing between steps. Step 2 is a bleaching gel and doesn't taste good. At all...I think the strong flavor of step 1 helps mask the poor taste, but it leaves a bad flavor in your mouth for a long time. After another minute you are done and you rinse as normal.<br /><br />This two part system is a little more inconvenient than normal toothpaste, but probably better than whitening trays. It wouldn't have been a problem, except I didn't see a difference in my tooth color after 2 weeks. For me, it was not worth the hassle. My mouth did feel clean, but I did not like the aftertaste or the sensation left by the bleaching agent.<br /><br />I also found the packaging to be strange. Step 1 is a flip cap that is easy to open. Step 2 is a screw cap that if you forget to open before you brush, is hard to open one handed...it's just stupid and I couldn't manage the stupidity of it all for longer than two weeks. I'm back to my regular toothpaste now. I might consider finishing up the Step 1 tube and toss Step 2. I don't need that kind of negativity in my life.<br /><br />I applaud Crest for indulging somebody's new idea. It just doesn't deliver enough of a difference in results to make up for the extra hassle.

  1658. About Me: I typically pick my toothpaste based on taste. I don't have any special dental needs i.e. sensitivity, but do feel that I have thinner enamel. I normally use and continue to like Crest Complete with Scope.<br /><br />This product was sent to me free of charge for review through BzzAgent and Crest.<br /><br />Product Details: Crest Pro Health HD Two Step Daily System comes packaged with two tubes. Step 1 is a purifying cleanser that contains Stannous fluoride 0.454% as the active ingredient. This tube weights 4.0 oz. Step 2 is the whitening/polish step that contains a hydrogen peroxide whitening gel. This tube weighs 2.3 oz.<br /><br />Usage: The directions state to brush your teeth for 1 minute with Step 1. Spit. Do not rinse. Then brush your teeth for 1 minute with Step 2. At first, I was thoroughly annoyed with having to be bothered with having to do two separate steps. But in reality, it really wasn't that much of a hassle. Once I got into the rhythm of brushing, spitting, remembering to not rinse!, and then repeating with step 2, I realized that it really wasn't that more more work. If anything, I started to like it because it forced me to be more conscious about how long I was brushing my teeth. Sometimes, &#34;two minutes&#34; is probably more like 30 seconds when it's late at night, and I'm a sleep zombie.<br /><br />Results: Honestly, I didn't see much whitening effect. That might just be because I have thin enamel on my teeth which allows the yellower dentin to show through. The product claims to have 6x whiter teeth in 1 week. I used the product for about 3 weeks to see if I could see significant whitening, and unfortunately, I did not. This product also claims to have 6x healthier mouth. That I can almost believe, although I question how they truly quantify that. The purifying cleanser step definitely gave my mouth a squeaky clean feel that lasts all day. As far as the taste of the toothpaste, it's not as minty fresh as Crest Complete Scope. But again, I didn't mind because that because the &#34;minty fresh&#34; feeling was replaced by the &#34;squeaky clean&#34; just got a &#34;dental cleaning&#34; feeling.<br /><br />Summary: Overall, I think it's a good product. I like the clean feeling that lasts all day. Again, maybe I have a predisposition with my teeth that does not allowing good whitening. I am going to have my husband test out the product to see if he sees any significant whitening. IF the whitening portion of the toothpaste does as it claims, then I can see the product being a good value. One of the things that I did have a question about was the large difference in tube size for Step1 and Step 2. I haven't finished the product yet, so I can't say if I will end up finishing one tube before the other. I will update as soon as I finish the product. Also, I noticed that some people stated sensitivity after using this product. Personally, I didn't notice any sensitivity for me.again, I didn't mind because that because the &#34;minty fresh&#34; feeling was replaced by the &#34;squeaky clean&#34; just got a &#34;dental cleaning&#34; feeling.<br /><br />Summary: Overall, I think it's a good product. I like the clean feeling that lasts all day. Again, maybe I have a predisposition with my teeth that does not allowing good whitening. I am going to have my husband test out the product to see if he sees any significant whitening. IF the whitening portion of the toothpaste does as it claims, then I can see the product being a good value. One of the things that I did have a question about was the large difference in tube size for Step1 and Step 2. I haven't finished the product yet, so I can't say if I will end up finishing one tube before the other. I will update as soon as I finish the product. Also, I noticed that some people stated sensitivity after using this product. Personally, I didn't notice any sensitivity for me.

  1662. I've been using the Crest Pro Health HD 2-step system for a few weeks now, thanks to Crest and BzzAgent. I've used other Crest and Crest Pro Health toothpastes in the past, but not for quite a while. I've never really had luck with other whitening toothpastes making any sort of significant difference in the look/color of my teeth. For these reasons, I was hopeful that the Crest Pro Health HD paste would be noticeably different. Unfortunately, I was a bit disappointed and found this paste to just be average. While some other whitening toothpastes are too harsh/strong for me and irritate my gums/mouth, I am happy to say that this product did not. I also liked the mild minty flavor of the purifying cleanser (step 1). The perfecting gel used in step 2 doesn't really seem to have a flavor to it (unless it's masked by the mint of step 1 which isn't rinsed out before you use step 2). I noticed on the label that the purifying cleanser contains stannous fluouride which, as the label also points out, can produce surface staining of the teeth. I found that fact a little bothersome and counterproductive. I'm not sure how much this product costs, but I'm guessing it is more expensive than your standard tube of toothpaste. I don't think it's worth the extra money or the extra step that is required. I haven't noticed any whitening of my teeth in the past few weeks, and someone actually took a close-up photo of me a couple weeks ago that made my teeth look more yellow than I thought they were! All in all, this toothpaste is nothing special, unfortunately.

  1666. *I received Crest Pro Health HD free as a promotion from the brand and am reviewing it based on my experience with the product.*<br /><br />Initial review after 2 days of use (my update after 1 week is included at the bottom):<br /><br />- Teeth definitely feel cleaner: Before using this regimen, I used to feel plaque stuck to my teeth when running my tongue over my teeth throughout the day. I've noticed that after using CPH HD most of my teeth (with the exception of some back molars) feel smooth and plaque-less all day. And even though the molars do not feel completely clean all day, they still feel cleaner than they did before using this product. - Teeth slightly whiter: After 2 days, I think that my teeth do look a little bit whiter. Since the product claims teeth will be 6x whiter after 1 week, I will give it a few more days to see if I see more dramatic results.<br />- 2 step system easy to use: Brushing 1 minute with each of the 2 toothpastes is easy enough. I love the feeling of the first step as it foams up and works to remove plaque - it kind of reminds me of scrubbing our tub clean! Its minty taste is on par with other toothpastes. As for the second step, I like it a little less because its taste is not as pleasant. Another reviewer described said it reminded her of how hydrogen peroxide tastes and I'd tend to agree. However, this step does really smooth out your teeth after the first step cleans it, which I suppose is the &#34;polishing&#34; part. All in all, after 2 days, I'm pretty happy with Crest Pro Health HD so far. Now I just have to check back in a week regarding the whitening results.<br /><br />*UPDATE* After a week of using Crest Pro Health HD I still find its 2-step regimen very easy and convenient to use. In addition to the clean feeling I get from Step 1 and the polished feeling I get from Step 2 (which pretty much lasts throughout the day), I've noticed that my breath is indeed fresher (especially in the morning - I am no longer self conscious about lingering morning breath). And I no longer notice the peroxide-like taste from gel in Step 2.<br /><br />Now the one thing I was most excited to test was Crest Pro Health HD's claim to whiten teeth up to 6x after a week's use. The product fell a bit short of the 6x claim, but I'd say that it whitened my teeth maybe about 2-3x, which I'd still consider a success (hence my 4 star rating). I'd also like to note that I think the color on my teeth looks a bit more even (meaning that specific stains do not seem to stand out as much).<br /><br />With all that said, I think I would repurchase this product (although I do acknowledge that the $15 price point is a little higher than I'd like to spend on toothpaste). However, I had taken a break from using Crest Pro Health HD for a few days and I felt plaque build up much quicker on my teeth throughout the day when using regular toothpaste. So even though I only partially experienced its claims for teeth whitening, I felt it did improve my overall oral health, making it worth buying.ous about lingering morning breath). And I no longer notice the peroxide-like taste from gel in Step 2.<br /><br />Now the one thing I was most excited to test was Crest Pro Health HD's claim to whiten teeth up to 6x after a week's use. The product fell a bit short of the 6x claim, but I'd say that it whitened my teeth maybe about 2-3x, which I'd still consider a success (hence my 4 star rating). I'd also like to note that I think the color on my teeth looks a bit more even (meaning that specific stains do not seem to stand out as much).<br /><br />With all that said, I think I would repurchase this product (although I do acknowledge that the $15 price point is a little higher than I'd like to spend on toothpaste). However, I had taken a break from using Crest Pro Health HD for a few days and I felt plaque build up much quicker on my teeth throughout the day when using regular toothpaste. So even though I only partially experienced its claims for teeth whitening, I felt it did improve my overall oral health, making it worth buying.

I also tried very hard not to eat or drink anything for 30 minutes after using, although the package didn't instruct me to do so.<br /><br />Flavor: I wasn't super excited about the flavor. The polishing gel definitely had a chemical/bleachy taste to it. The cleaning gel flavor wasn't so bad.<br /><br />Whitening: Im not sure this product did a superb job at making my teeth whiter.<br /><br />Clean feel: I definitely feel like my teeth were very clean after using this product. Im not sure if I attribute that to the product itself or the fact that I normally don't brush for 2 solid minutes every day and I did during this time.<br /><br />Convenience: Not so much... it would be great if this product were combined into one gel. Maybe that would eliminate or at least mask the bleach taste I had after the polishing gel. I'm not sure if there is a scientific reason to using the two gels separately, other than committing to two minutes of brushing versus one.<br /><br />In conclusion, I would use this product again if it were given to me but would not run out and purchase it. I don't think I will be replacing my current regular toothpaste with this product as it didn't' necessarily prove to be beneficial to me.
  1672. Took some time to see results but when I did I loved it. Honestly I am an impatient person so when I didn't see results right away I hesitated to use again. But after reading the direction again it says that you will see results in about a week. So I gave it that amount of time and saw results. I could feel the difference in my teeth on how clean and white they were. It only takes a minute longer than using just one toothpaste. so it definitely isn't time consuming.

It’s also expensive for toothpaste but if it works, the system is much cheaper and convenient than using whitening strips or getting your teeth professionally whitened.<br /><br />I will definitely continue to use Crest Pro-Health HD until the containers are empty, but I haven’t decided yet if I will purchase it on my own afterward.

  1697. I'm a pretty good tooth brusher. My hygienist compliments my brushing and flossing each time I come in for a cleaning (2x/year). In other words, I know how to keep my teeth clean.<br /><br />Now let me tell you about my experience with Crest Pro Health HD. When Bzzagent offered me the chance to try this product, I was somewhat excited. Hey, free toothpaste! Right?<br /><br />But now that I've actually been using Pro Health HD, I'm really glad I signed up. The promise is that you'll have 6x whiter teeth in a week. Tooth &#34;whiteness&#34; has never been that big of a deal to me, but maybe that's because I'm not a smoker or coffee drinker, so my teeth stay pretty white on their own with regular brushing. So I was surprised that after only a few days, my teeth seemed whiter, brighter. Not in a fakey, car-salesman kind of way, but in a real, &#34;hey- you-have-nice-teeth&#34; kind of way.<br /><br />Here's how it works. Pro Health HD is a two-step brushing process. Step one feels and tastes like normal toothpaste, but with a little extra texture from the baking soda. You brush with that for one minute, then spit. DON'T RINSE YET! (And don't rinse your toothbrush either.) Step 2 doesn't look or taste or feel much like normal toothpaste. It's absolutely clear, and less-viscous than toothpaste, and sort of absorbs into the bristles of your tooth brush. This is the peroxide, and I assume &#34;whitening&#34; step that Step 1 has just prepped you for. I'll admit that the for the first few times, I didn't like the taste of Step 2, but that was because of the peroxide. After that, I didn't mind it so much.<br /><br />A couple of things you'll have noticed. Yes, it takes longer, and yes, you're brushing your teeth twice. Which begs the question: Could I get the same result just brushing my teeth twice with normal toothpaste?<br /><br />(This is a non-scientific answer, but deal with it. I'm not a scientist.) No, and here's why. The two-step process uses different products that are complementary, not the same product twice. Step 1 is the cleaner. It strips all the bad stuff away and preps your teeth for Step 2 by leaving some of the baking soda in your mouth. Step 2 is the polishing stage. Anything you missed in step one is annihilated, and the peroxide reacts with the baking soda to deep clean and polish.<br /><br />So what do I think? I think that I have never before used a toothpaste or cleaning system that has made my teeth feel so clean as Pro Health HD. Honest. It is literally the closest thing I've experienced to the feeling of getting my teeth cleaned at the dentist, only much more convenient. And my teeth seem whiter. I say &#34;seem&#34; because I didn't take before and after photos.<br /><br />Any downsides? Brushing twice takes twice as long, so if you're in a hurry, this is not the way to go. For the first couple of weeks trying this product, I used it exclusively. I'll admit that it made my mouth and gums a little sensitive, but when I backed off a little, that went away.<br /><br />Bottom line, this stuff rocks. I only use it once a day now, at night before bed. In the morning I use regular toothpaste. I think this method gives me the benefits of using Pro Health HD, but saves me time in the morning. Plus, this stuff is a little pricey, so I think this is a great way to get the product benefits but without having to buy it as often. I'd go full bore for a week or two when you first buy this, though. That way you get the full whitening effect.are complementary, not the same product twice. Step 1 is the cleaner. It strips all the bad stuff away and preps your teeth for Step 2 by leaving some of the baking soda in your mouth. Step 2 is the polishing stage. Anything you missed in step one is annihilated, and the peroxide reacts with the baking soda to deep clean and polish.<br /><br />So what do I think? I think that I have never before used a toothpaste or cleaning system that has made my teeth feel so clean as Pro Health HD. Honest. It is literally the closest thing I've experienced to the feeling of getting my teeth cleaned at the dentist, only much more convenient. And my teeth seem whiter. I say &#34;seem&#34; because I didn't take before and after photos.<br /><br />Any downsides? Brushing twice takes twice as long, so if you're in a hurry, this is not the way to go. For the first couple of weeks trying this product, I used it exclusively. I'll admit that it made my mouth and gums a little sensitive, but when I backed off a little, that went away.<br /><br />Bottom line, this stuff rocks. I only use it once a day now, at night before bed. In the morning I use regular toothpaste. I think this method gives me the benefits of using Pro Health HD, but saves me time in the morning. Plus, this stuff is a little pricey, so I think this is a great way to get the product benefits but without having to buy it as often. I'd go full bore for a week or two when you first buy this, though. That way you get the full whitening effect.
  1698. I received this system as part of a promotion. I did some a slight improvement in the brightness of my teeth. My teeth didn't feel as clean as they do with my regular toothpaste. I ended up using both this system and my regular toothpaste to ensure my teeth were totally clean
  1699. I was very excited to try Crest Pro Health HD becasue I have noticed for some time that my teeth had a yellowinsh tint to them. I tried this product as a promotion from the brand. This product claimed to provide a healthier mouth and 6 times whiter teeth in one week. I have used Crest toothpast my entire life so the product brought instant credibility to me. This is a short two step process that takes two minutes each time you use it. The insturctions could not be any simplier. The first tube of paste is clearly marked Step 1. You brush with this cleaning paste for one minute. After a minute you do not rinse and then move on to step 2. Step 2 is the whitening gel. Once again you brush for a minute and then rinse when finished. How easier can this get? You don't have to mess around with sticking strips of bleeching tape on your teeth. This was very easy and efficient! After using the Crest Pro Health HD, my mouth definitely feels cleaner than before. I really noticed that this product eliminates plaque build-up. When I floss, I no longer have plaque. My dental hygenist is going to be happy! After using the whitening gel, I did notice an immiediate difference in my teeth getting whiter. I noticed somewhat of a difference but I did not get any comments from my wife or kids about my teeth getting whiter. I did not have any difficulty with sensitivity after using this product. Overall, I feel as though Crest Pro Health HD makes my mouth feel cleaner, but did not seem to make my teeth white enough to make me want to buy the product. I would only recommend this product if you wanted to get rid of plaque and at the same time get rid of any yellowish tint you might have to your teeth.ifficulty with sensitivity after using this product.   1701. I received a free package of the new Crest ProHealth HD as a BzzAgent. I found that Crest ProHealth HD worked effectively and it was easy to use. Also, because you brush one minute first with the ProHealth tube and then brush for one minute with the whitening/polishing gel, you are making sure that you're brushing as much as your dentist recommends! The whitening/polishing gel was gentle on my teeth, and didn't cause sensitivity the way trays or whitening strips do sometimes, and also had a pleasant taste. Best of all, the whole procedure doesn't take any longer than your usual brushing time. I drink tea and coffee every day, and I was able to notice visible whitening after a day's brushing. It doesn't get your teeth that &#34;glow in the dark&#34; white, but if you want a natural-looking, clean, healthy-looking white, this 2-step system works great.
  1702. Amazing results after two weeks of use! I got this free to test, and I was skeptical of needing two different toothpastes to get this job done. I was quickly shown the difference: The two products work in conjunction to whiten and polish teeth, removing stains and build up deposited over time. It's fabulous! I liked it far better than the 3D Vivid White toothpastes and other whitening products I've used over the years. The different toothpastes have unusual textures, but they're not unlike other whitening or prescription toothpastes I've used. I think you'll like it too!

  1704. When I first heard about Crest Pro Health HD, I have to admit that I had hoped it would involve a bit of magic. I thought that maybe there was finally a simple (although a bit pricey) way to get impressive whitening + cleaning results in no time at all. What I found is that the toothpaste works well to clean my teeth and I do feel that the second gel tub adds a special layer of protection but I cannot say I've seen a stark change in the whiteness of my teeth. An unexpected benefit of the two tube system is that it makes the two minutes you're supposed to brush your teeth go by a lot faster because you have more to do during that time. The instructions suggest using the paste from tube one for about one minute and the same for the gel (no rising till you're done!). It took a few days for me to get the routine down but now I appreciate using a system that I feel not only cleans my teeth but then protects (and maybe slowly whitens?) them. Overall, I'd recommend Crest Pro Health HD because while it may not make magic in your mouth, it does make it feel clean and fresh all day with an added polish.   1710. Use the gel from STEP 2 tube and polish the teeth for about 1 minute. Once both the steps are done in the order defined; spit and rinse the teeth.<br /><br />I have been using the Crest HD for about three weeks now and I was able to see difference in my teeth from Yellow to a very light yellow (but not super white like few others has posted). One would think this level of whitening could be incorporated in a single step process. I don't have overly sensitive teeth, however, this toothpaste really did a number on my teeth and gums. This is the first whitening product that actually turned my gums white. I had several white spots on my gum line, which was a bit concerning. After the second use, on the first day, I had to rinse with warm water, because my teeth were sensitive to cold. By the third day, (I really wanted to stick with this... even if I did have some sensitivity and temporary white spots), my gums began to bleed in spots. Since this product says your teeth will be six times whiter in one week, I was going to hang in there for the entire week. After a week of use as instructed on the packaging, the bleeding stopped and the white spots on my teeth had disappeared. I did notice slightly whiter teeth, but certainly not six times whiter teeth. Frankly, I've seen better results from one step tooth pastes that were less expensive and not as harmful to my teeth and gums. If your goal is whiter teeth, invest in whitening strips. They may cause temporary sensitivity, but the results are immediate and you, most likely, won't have bleeding gums. <br /><br />Disclaimer: I received the Crest Pro Health HD free, courtesy of Crest and for being a BzzAgent. Overall, I like this product and will continue using it, hoping to see continued results.   1756. I too received a free sample of this to try. I'm quite pleased with the results. I haven't experienced any sensitivity or pain from using this. I also find the taste to be pleasant in general, and I do feel that the stains on my teeth are disappearing and my teeth are getting whiter. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that it is a 2 step process. I understand the logic behind it, but there are nights where I'm just too tired to mess with the 2 steps. I know that makes me sound incredibly lazy, but it is the truth. As a busy mom of 3 young kids, I consider it an achievement to wash my face, brush my teeth, and floss on some nights. That's when I'm reaching for my old toothpaste. It's definitely not a hard process and probably my own issue, but in the spirit of being completely honest that's where I'm at with the toothpaste! I would recommend it to anyone looking for a way to whiten their teeth without the use of strips or other methods.

Even using this product every couple of days still shown signs of my teeth becoming whiter.<br /><br />If you don't have sensitive teeth, this product may be great for you.
