I thought it was a little weird that you are not suppose to rinse your mouth between the two toothpastes.
  1759. I've tried out different whitening products before; whitening strips and mouthwash make my teeth hurt and end up being sensitive for days, and whitening toothpaste doesn't really seem to do anything. My teeth were uncomfortable the first day I used this, but nothing that wasn't manageable. The sensitivity was gone the second day, although I noticed that I couldn't rinse my mouth out with cool water without my tongue feeling like it was on fire. I started using warm water and it lessens the effect, although the feeling is still there. I like the fact that my teeth feel like I just had a cleaning at the dentist (without the pain of a dental cleaning) every time I use this, although I do wonder how safe this is to use long term. I suppose I'll need to consult my dentist about that. I'll continue to use what remains of the product and will decide at that time if I want to buy it to continue using it. I can't say I've seen the 6X whiter results in a week that they say on the box, but I have noticed at least some difference, without the sensitivity that usually accompanies whitening products, so that's a plus.

  1796. I was asked to try Crest Pro Health® HD by Crest via Bzz Agent almost a month ago, and I have to say that it takes some commitment beyond the usual brush and go. It seems to work better than white strips but perhaps not as well as one of those expensive bleachings at the dentist.   1797. I received the Crest Pro-Health HD toothpaste for free as a part of a promotion from Crest via BuzzAgent. Admittedly, I was rather skeptical at first about this toothpaste. At first I thought this was just my mouth getting used to a new toothpaste, but after a month or so of using it, my mouth still tends to feel cleaner than it did before using this. That may make the toothpaste worth it just on that alone.<br /><br />Now the toothpaste does also claim a whitening effect. This I noticed less, but did still notice at least a little. It wasn't 6x whiter, whatever was exactly meant by that, but I did notice that my teeth were a little whiter. I simply considered this a little perk in addition to the cleaner feeling teeth.<br /><br />Now I mentioned some drawbacks and there are a few. The first is that the two step process takes some getting used to. You just need to have a timer or a watch handy when brushing your teeth. It's a little annoying, but they tell you this straight out. It's still a minor hassle, but not enough to take anything away from the product.<br /><br />Another drawback was that we experienced a little sensitivity after we started using it. This cleared up after a bit, but I'm sure that something like this varies from person to person. So it's something to be aware of. Again we didn't experience it much so I'm not really holding it against the toothpaste either.<br /><br />Probably the most significant drawback is the price. While I received the toothpaste for free as I mentioned above, the toothpaste is a bit pricey. While I do think that the added clean feeling to my teeth and a subtle whitening effect may be worth it, it would be the one block towards regularly purchasing it.<br /><br />Overall though, I was more impressed with the toothpaste than I thought I would be. It has some drawbacks but none that are too bad. The worst is the price, but even then it may be worth it. If I could I'd probably give it a 4.5 stars instead of a 5 overall, but I had a good experience with this toothpaste and do recommend that you at least give it a try.think that the added clean feeling to my teeth and a subtle whitening effect may be worth it, it would be the one block towards regularly purchasing it.<br /><br />Overall though, I was more impressed with the toothpaste than I thought I would be. It has some drawbacks but none that are too bad. The worst is the price, but even then it may be worth it. If I could I'd probably give it a 4.5 stars instead of a 5 overall, but I had a good experience with this toothpaste and do recommend that you at least give it a try.
  1798. I recently received the opportunity to try this product thanks to BzzAgent & Crest. I was skeptical of the results I would see in just 6 days, but I was pleasantly surprised! The two step process is easy to follow. Brush for 1 minute with step #1, spit (but don't rinse), then brush with step #2 for another minute, spit and rinse! Do this twice a day for 6 days and you will notice your teeth are whiter! I also loved how clean my teeth felt and how fresh my breath was. I've tried other whitening processes in the past and this is so much easier. I definitely wasn't disappointed. I'm so happy with the results!
  1799. This toothpaste has a nice texture and grit to it. Not a smooth feel, so it seems like you're getting a better cling to yout teeth.
  1800. When this product arrived, I was both excited and skeptical. I have been using home whitening kits/products off and on for the better part of 15 years. I have found that, like most things, some worked well, and others flopped. This product, however, is a big win. My teeth in general are generally white, but I drink soda and coffee throughout the day, so it seems like from bed to morning my teeth lose their shine. I also only brush in the mornings due to somewhat sensitive gums. The first time I used this product I was amazed. My teeth were instantly whiter and had an overall whiter tone. I have found that every time I use this product my teeth are brighter, and whiter. I also deviate from the directions slightly and do 2mins for each cycle. I do this because Im too lazy to count the vibrations and beeps from my sonicare in the morning. So I just go the full 2mins for each step. lol I did include a before and after picture from this morning. You can see my teeth are still somewhat dingy in the tell tale corners and crevices, but overall much brighter and whiter looking. I will say the only two things I noticed as a negative was that I saw some occasional white spotting on my gums. This may be just my experience or a combination of having lightly sensitive gums, and doing it for 4 minutes total. My best guess would be that the peroxide in step one lightens any irritated area. My only other negative would be that the mouth feel of step one is... odd. It drys out your mouth like crazy. Like cotton mouth x100, hangover dehydration mouth and not having water for 5 days dry. You get used to it (ish) - but still worth mentioning.

  1810. I was sent Crest Pro Health HD whitening toothpaste to try and review from Crest. I was not impressed with this 2-step whitening toothpaste. I am not one to consider myself having sensitive teeth and/or gums, but I couldn't use this as directed for more than 3 days. The first three days I used it in the morning and in the evening. At the beginning of day 3, my mouth was so sensitive and all the product was doing was turning my gums white. I couldn't eat or drink anything for an hour because it heightened my sensitivity so much. After three days I didn't notice a difference but I thought that if I could at least use it once a day I would see results in about 4 weeks. Other than only using it once per day, I followed the directions exactly as written and still saw no results after 4 weeks. I was so disappointed that even after three weeks of pain, white gums, and even bleeding gums, I saw absolutely no results. I'm sure this 2-step Crest Pro-Health HD works for some people, but it just didn't work for me.
  1811. After using Crest Pro Health HD for several weeks now, I do feel like my mouth is healthier, but since my teeth weren't really in need of whitening before, I can't really attest to its whitening abilities. I couldn't see a noticeable difference in whitening. It does leave my mouth feeling different and cleaner than before, but I would prefer it to have a stronger mint taste. I don't really feel like the mint is strong enough to freshen my breath. The taste is fine for both steps, but it's just very mild, which I suppose is good for people who don't like a strong mint taste. The two-step process isn't really a big deal for me, since I have an electric toothbrush that has a 1-minute setting on it. I brush with the first step until my toothbrush stops after a minute, and then I add the gel and brush for another minute. I don't really need to spit in between the two steps like the directions say to do, but I don't think that's a requirement. The main thing, I think, is just to make sure you don't rinse in between. Since the gel tube is nearly half the size of the purifying cleanser tube, I took that to mean I shouldn't use as much of the gel, but I still think I will run out of gel before I run out of cleanser. When I first read the packaging, I was a little concerned about the warning that you may experience temporary symptoms like white spots or oral discomfort when using this product, but I didn't experience anything like that. Overall, though, I think that for the price and the fact that I don't really need to whiten my teeth on a daily basis, I will continue to use the original Crest Pro Health that I was using before I tried their new HD product, but I really appreciate being given this to try out for free from BzzAgent and Crest.

  1813. I have tried to use teeth whitening products off and on for years. I say off and on, because usually the only ones that I have really seen work are the products that require you to pour some really nasty tasting gel into a plastic tray and put it in your mouth every day. Between work, being a single dad and all the things that requires, trying to remember to add in an extra step in my daily routine to deal with those trays meant I never completed a regimen. Crest Pro-Heath HD solves this problem by creating a system which can whiten my teeth without adding any extra steps to my daily routine. That's a big winner in my book. When I saw the opportunity to try this out thanks to BzzAgent, I couldn't wait. Crest Pro-Health HD doesn't taste bad, and does what it says in regards to whitening my teeth. The time requirements (a min for step 1 and then for step 2) could be a bit tricky as most people don't really have a timer for their teeth brushing. Fortunately, my Sonicare toothbrush handled that for me. My mouth also felt fresh afterwards which again was a HUGE win for me over other products. Still not sure if I got six shades whiter in two weeks, but I definitely noticed a difference and can see myself using this as my new Crest toothpaste.
